Kennedy operates an electronics stall selling radios and power chords.  He has been in this business for the last 10 years, making a monthly income of KES.10,000. He is taking his first loan from KADET LTD, with which he will buy more stock of radios and power extensions for sale. 

His profits will be used to expand his business.  His dream is to buy land and build a house for the family

loans.use: To buy radios and power extensions for sale.

loans.name: Violeta 1 Group

texts.en:
Adriana is the coordinator of her group, Violeta (Violet) group 1.  This group is located in Los Alcarrizos, a dusty urban area where there are many free trade zones and where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her 5 children.  Being a single mother, her most difficult challenge has been to raise her children and educate them.  Now some are grown and help her to take care of the younger ones. 

Adriana is excited to be taking out her 7th loan with Esperanza, after having successfully repaid her previous loans and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling miscellaneous products, like used clothes, cartons of eggs and boiled beans. She started with a very small business 7 years ago, where she just sold boiled beans.  Then, reinvesting her profits, she added eggs and clothes. Now she is very proud to sell many different products, and she will invest this loan to increase her inventory. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: to buy second hand clothes packs, eggs cartons, beans, etc.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is from Maningcol, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental. She is 50 years old. Rebecca is married and has one adult child.

To make a living, Rebecca owns and operates a business venture, baking & selling a variety of baked goods in the local community. Rebecca has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 2,300 PHP a month from these activities.

Rebecca is requesting a loan of 2,500 PHP, which will be used to add additional capital to her business. In 2008, Rebecca joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: add capital to her business

loans.name: Veith

texts.en: Veith, 54, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She and her husband have been involved in growing rice for over twenty years, earning approximately USD 5 per day. Her two daughters are employed in a garment factory and earn approximately USD 6 per day. In order to improve her family livelihood, Veith is requesting for a loan of USD 1000 to purchase more farmland for growing rice to generate more income to support the family. In the future, she would like to run a sewing shop for her children and build a bathroom.

loans.use: buy farmland to grow rice

loans.name: Jesugnon Group

texts.fr: Le groupe JESUGNON est formé de quatre personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Béatrice, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. Béatrice est âgée de 42 ans et est mariée à un certain Antoine. Le couple a cinq enfants, tous à leur charge, et dont certains sont scolarisés. Béatrice vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants et assure ensemble avec son mari les diverses charges de la famille. Béatrice n’a pas fréquenté l'école. Il y a quatre ans que Béatrice prépare de la bouillie de mil accompagné de beignets (faits à base de farine de blé) qu'elle vend dans son quartier. De façon secondaire, Béatrice vend de la pâte de maïs accompagnée de sauce dans son quartier. Béatrice s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d'affaire, Béatrice sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe JESUGNON, un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les deux crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The JESUGNON group consists of four women who live in the same neighborhood.  Béatrice is the representative of the group, and she is the one raising her hand in the photo.  She is 42 years old and married to a man named Antoine.  The couple has five children, all in their care.  Some of their children attend school.  Béatrice lives with her husband and children and takes care of the various family expenses with her husband.

Béatrice never attended school.  For the past four years, she has been preparing millet porridge and fritters (made with wheat flour), and selling them in her neighborhood.  Additionally, she also sells "maize pâte" (a staple food in Benin) served with sauce, also in her neighborhood.  She buys her supplies in Benin.

In order to better meet the needs of her customers, and to increase her turnover,  Béatrice is requesting a third loan from  ALIDé, along with the other members of the JESUGNON group.  The two loans which were previously received have been duly repaid.

loans.use: to buy some millet, sugar, wheat flour and vegetable oil.

loans.name: Violeta 2 Group

texts.en:
Mayelin is the coordinator of her group Violeta 2 (Violet). Her group is located in Los Alcarrizos, a dusty industrial area north of the capital where free trade zones are common. She makes her home in a simple structure with her long-term partner. She says that her most difficult challenge is to become a mother; she is only 24 years old. In the meantime she plans to continue enjoying studying.

Mayelin is excited to be taking her fourth loan with Esperanza, after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She has had her business for a year, starting with her first Esperanza loan, with her sister teaching her to do business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying kids' and women's clothing and underwear. She will use the profits to invest in her business and finish her studies. She wishes to run her own clothing store and become a professional.

loans.use: To buy clothes and underwear for kids and women

loans.name: Harold

texts.en: Harold is married and has seven children. He is 52 years old and resides in Inroad, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. Harold used his last loan to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise for his crops business. His farming business is successful and he is taking a new loan to repair an existing vehicle for better service for his transport business. In the future, he hopes to be able to improve his business.

loans.use: repair his vehicle for better service

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is from Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is 50 years old. Regina is married and has two children. 

To make a living, Regina is running a coffee and snack shop, selling a variety of food and home products in the local community such as "suman", "puto", bread and many other items. Regina has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from these activities.

Regina is requesting a loan of 5,057 PHP, which will be used to add additional working capital for the business. In 1997, Regina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to finish the studies for her children.

loans.use: add working capital to her business

loans.name: Hou

texts.en:
Hou is 60 and married. She resides with her husband and three children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She and her husband have been selling wooden coal for over ten years, earning approximately 15 USD daily. 

Due to transportation difficulties, Hou is requesting a 1,000 USD loan to purchase a motorbike to transport the family. This purchase will enable her to use the money saved on transportation expenses to support the family. In the future, Hou would like to expand her business and build a new house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike

loans.name: Veith

texts.en:
Veith is 49 and is married. She resides with her husband in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. For the past ten years, the couple has been running a fruit-selling business and they earn approximately 30 USD each day.

Veith is requesting a 500 USD loan to improve her business by purchasing a truck to transport her produce to market. This will enable her to carry fruits faster and in larger quantities. In the future, Veith will use her profits to further expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase a truck to carry fruit to market

loans.name: Jesukpego Group

texts.fr: JESUKPEGO est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres vivent dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, Suzanne (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 51 ans. Suzanne est mariée à un chauffeur du nom de Stéphane. Le couple a dix enfants tous scolarisés, mais seulement deux sont à leur charge. Suzanne vit ensemble avec son mari et ses deux enfants à charge. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Suzanne n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Pour faire face à ses différentes charges, Suzanne vend depuis cinq ans, des friperies, des bois de chauffage et des produits cosmétiques dans une ville du Bénin. Suzanne s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de mieux satisfaire les exigences de sa clientèle, Suzanne sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe JESUKPEGO, un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le premier  crédit reçu a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
Jesukpego is a group of three persons; all members live in the same area.

Suzanne is the representative of the group (her hand is raised on the photo). She is 51 years old and is married to a driver named Stephane. The couple has 10 children, all attended school, but only two of them are her dependents. Suzanne lives together with her husband and her two dependent children. The couple provides together for the various household expenses. 

Suzanne never attended school. To cover her various expenses she has been selling used clothing, firewood and cosmetics for the last five years in a town of Benin. Suzanne gets her supplies in a market in Benin.

In order to strengthen her activity and to better meet her customers’ demand, she is requesting along with the other members of the Jesukpego group, a second loan from ALIDé. The first loan they received has been fully reimbursed.

loans.use: purchase used clothing, firewood and body lotions.

loans.name: Evengeline

texts.en:
Evengeline is from Lapinig, Kapatagan, Lanao del Norte. She is 45 years old. Evengeline is married and has 5 children. To make a living, Evengeline owns & operates a business venture, buying and selling bananas in the local community. Evengeline has been engaged in her business for 20 years and earns 3,000 PHP a month from these activities. 

In 2010, Evengeline joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Evengeline is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional bananas to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: buy bananas

loans.name: Neda

texts.en: Neda is from Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She is married and has 3 children. Neda used her last loan to purchase grocery supplies to sell in her general store. Her store business is successful and she's taking a new loan to purchase livestock feed & other supplies for her swine business. In the future, she hopes to be able to grow her businesses.

loans.use: buy livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Phach

texts.en:
Phach is 60 and married. She resides with her husband and seven children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. For the past 20 years, Phach and her husband have been farmers and they have extensive experience and are successful in their careers. They are involved in growing rice and raising cattle and they earn approximately 7 USD each day. Three of Phach's children are employed in a garment factory and they earn about 9 USD per day. 

Phach is requesting a 1,000 USD loan to begin a new business to improve her family's income. She will use her loan to purchase cosmetics to run a beauty salon so that her children can generate more income. In the future, Phach would like to build a new house and help her children to study the Korean language in order to find jobs in Korea.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics to begin a beauty salon

loans.name: Ndeye Bineta

texts.fr: Mademoiselle Ndeye Bineta  est une célibataire de 34 ans qui vit dans une des localités sénégalaises. Elle s’active  depuis 3 ans dans le secteur du commerce et s’adonne a la vente de produits cosmétiques. C’est une activité qu’elle a choisi par nécessité. Auparavant elle était une employée domestique et a cause du non respect de ses droits elle a opté pour une activité commerciale plus lucrative. Elle est sociétaire de l’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC  depuis 8 ans. Elle a déjà remboursé un crédit antérieur. Elle sollicite un crédit de 150 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de produits cosmétiques  qui seront destinés a la vente. Son objectif est de renforcer son activité et en meme temps la diversifier. Ce financement lui permettra de mieux rentabiliser son chiffre d’affaire et  de s’autofinancer.
texts.en: Ndeye Bineta is a 34-year-old single woman who lives in one of Senegal's localities.  For the past three years she has been actively involved in the sale of cosmetic products.  This is an activity she chose out of necessity.  She used to work as a domestic helper, but because her rights were not respected, she chose to have a more lucrative commercial activity.  She has been a member of one the local UIMCEC branches for 8 years, and has already repaid a previous loan.  She is now requesting a loan in the amount of 150,000 francs which will be used to buy cosmetic products for resale.  Her goal is to boost and diversify her business.  This loan will allow her to increase her profits and turnover, and lead to self-finance.

loans.use: to buy cosmetic products for resale.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is from Kahayagan East, Aurora Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 50 years old. Rosalinda is a widow and has 2 children. 

To make a living, Rosalinda owns & operates a business venture, buying and selling dried fish in the local community. Rosalinda has been engaged in her business for 12 years and earns 4,000 PHP a month from these activities. 

In 2007, Rosalinda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosalinda is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional dried fish to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: buy dried fish

location.town: Kahayaham East, Aurora ZAmboanga Del Sur

loans.name: Emelyn

texts.en:
Emelyn is from Lapinig, Kapatagan, Lanao del Norte. She is 34 years old. Emelyn is single and has 2 children. 

To make a living, Emelyn has been in the vegetables vending business for 6 years and earns 2,300 PHP a month from these activities.

Emelyn is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase more vegetables to sell.  In 2010, Emelyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: buy vegetables

loans.name: Rechel

texts.en:
Rechel is from Lapinig, Kapatagan, Lanao del Norte. She is 30 years old. Rechel is married and has three children. 

To make a living, Rechel is running a general store, selling a variety of food and home products in the local community. Rechel has been in her business for 8 years and earns 2,000 PHP a month from these activities.

Rechel is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. In 2010, Rechel joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: buy products for her store

loans.name: Mellie

texts.en:
Mellie is from Mantic, Tangub CIty. She is 54 years old. Mellie is married and has two children. 

To make a living, Mellie is running a "ukay2x" (thrift shop), selling a variety of used clothes in the local community. Mellie has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month from these activities.

Mellie is requesting a loan of 14,000 PHP, which will be used as additional working capital for the business. In 2009, Mellie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: add working capital to her business

loans.name: Trinite Group

texts.fr: Le groupe TRINITE est composé de trois personnes qui vivent dans le même quartier au Bénin. La représentante de ce groupe, du nom de Brigitte Ablawa est celle ayant la main levée sur la photo. Dans le but de rehausser le niveau de leur activité et de mieux faire face à la demande de leur clientèle, le groupe TRINITE sollicite pour la troisième fois l’appui financier de ALIDé. Brigitte Ablawa  n’a jamais fréquenté l’école. Brigitte Ablawa est âgée de 27 ans et est mariée à un certain Cyprien. Le couple a un enfant non scolarisé et à leur charge. Pour contribuer aux besoins de sa famille, Brigitte Ablawa mène comme activité depuis plus de sept ans, la vente de produits cosmétiques et des mèches à travers le canal de distribution. Brigitte Ablawa s’approvisionne dans un marché du Benin. Dans le but de renforcer leur activité et de mieux satisfaire leur clientèle, Brigitte Ablawa et les autres membres du groupe TRINITE sollicitent un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Leur ambition est d’accroître le niveau de leur activité.
texts.en:
The Trinite group is composed of three persons who all live in the same neighborhood in Benin. The representative of the group is named Brigitte Ablawa. Her hand is raised on the photo.

In order to increase the level of their activity and to better meet their customers’ requests, the Trinite group is requesting Alidé’s financial support for the third time.

Brigitte Ablawa never attended school. She is 27 years old and married to someone named Cyprien. The couple has one child who is their dependent and not attending school. To provide for her family’s needs, Brigitte Ablawa’s activity has been to sell cosmetic products and hair extensions for the last seven years through the distribution system. She gets her supplies in a market in Benin.

In order to increase the level of their activity and to better meet their customers’ demands Brigitte Ablawa and the other Trinite group members are requesting a third loan from ALIDé. Their ambition is to increase the level of their activity.

loans.use: purchase hair extensions and cosmetic products.

loans.name: Munira

texts.ru: Мунире 42 года, она шьет женские национальные платья. У нее сезон в основном с весны по осень, когда много свадеб и мероприятий. От накопленных средств она планировала купить мебель для дома. Но наколенные средства недостачны для покупки мебели , поэтому она обратилась в МДО "Арванд" и узнала о финансовой поддержки КИВА. Она всячески благодарна, о существовании таких организации, которые могут поддержать в трудную минуту.
texts.en: Munira is 42 years old. She sews traditional women's dresses. Her busy season is mainly from spring to autumn, when many weddings and other events take place. Munira was planning to buy furniture for her home using her savings. However, their amount was insufficient, and so she turned to MDO Arvand, LLC and learned about the financial support offered by Kiva. She is very grateful for the existence of such organizations that can offer help in a difficult time.

loans.use: to purchase furniture for her home

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 35 years old and married with four children, three of whom are sill in school. She lives in Yambio and has run a food stall for the last year. Victoria heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer and this will be her first BRAC loan.

Victoria is requesting a 500 SDG loan to purchase onions and beans. She will use the extra income from her loan to pay school fees.

loans.use: to purchase onions and beans

loans.name: Sahaya

texts.en:
Sahaya is 45 years old and married with two children. She works very hard to provide for them. For the past ten years, Sahaya has run a general store in the Philippines where she sells a variety of items such as canned goods, spices, rice, soap and other products. 

Sahaya is requesting a 30,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell. In the future Sahaya would like to save money and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise to sell

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 35 years old and married with four children, three of whom are still in school. She lives in Yambio and has sold charcoal for the past two years. Jane heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer and this will be her second BRAC loan.

Jane is requesting a 1,000 SDG loan to purchase charcoal. She will use the extra income from her loan to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal to sell

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is 44 years old, married, and has 3 children, 2 of them are in school.  

Alma is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines.  She has been raising pigs for 10 years now and has borrowed 19 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

Alma requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.  She would like to build and expand her piggery business to secure the future for her family.

loans.use: buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia lives in Yambio.  She operates a food stall and has been in business for three years.  She is 30 years old, married, and has four children, three of them are still in school. 

Lucia heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of SDG 400 in order to purchase rice and beans.  She will use her extra income from this loan to pay school fees.

loans.use: buy rice and beans

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 31 years old, married and has four children. With 2 children in school, Virginia works very hard to provide for them.

Virginia runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines.  She has been in business for 3 years and sells a variety of items such as snack food, noodles and other groceries.  She has requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy stocks of groceries to sell in her sari-sari store.

In the future, Virginia would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: restock her store

loans.name: Linet

texts.en:
Linet is a married woman. She has 3 children and all are enrolled in school.  Her husband works as a mechanic. 

Linet operates a food stall business and sells her goods at the market. She's worked in this business for 10 years. Her primary customers are neighbours and town dwellers. Linet's other source of income includes her husband's earning. She describes her greatest business challenge to be seasonality and her highest monthly expense is food and school fees. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

Linet will use the KES 20,000 loan to purchase 2 bags of omena (fish) to sell. Linet aspires to establish a restaurant business in the future. She joined Yehu to access capital.

loans.use: buy fish

loans.name: Joice

texts.en:
Joice lives in Yambio.  She sells clothes and has been in this business for three years.  She is 35 years old, married, and has four children, three of them are still in school 

Joice heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer.  This is her fourth loan from BRAC.  She has requested a loan of SDG 2000 in order to purchase clothes to sell.  She will use her extra income from this loan to pay school fees.

loans.use: buy clothes to resell

loans.name: Anselma

texts.en:
Anselma, 48, is married and has seven children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

For the past five years Anselma has sold fish in the Philippines. She is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan amount from NWTF to buy more fish to sell.

In the future, Anselma would like to save enough to consistently support her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Dima

texts.en:
Dima, 35, is married with four children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

For fifteen years Dima has sold fish in the Philippines. She is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan from NWTF to purchase fishing gear and make repairs on her fishing boat.

Dima would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase fishing gear and make repairs on her fishing boat.

loans.name: Mwanaharusi

texts.en: Mwanaharusi is a married woman. She has two children, and both are enrolled in school. Her husband works as a blacksmith. Mwanaharusi operates a boda boda (motorcycle transport) business at the market. Her primary customers are passersby. Mwanaharusi's other source of income includes her husband's earnings. She describes her greatest business challenge to be the high cost of fuel, and her highest monthly expenses are rent bills and school fees. She rents a house that has both electricity and piped water. Mwanaharusi will use the 25,000 Kenyan shillings loan to pay school fees for her child. Mwanaharusi aspires to become self-reliant in the future. She joined Yehu to access capital.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her child.

loans.name: Gladys Mercedes

texts.es:
Gladys tiene 52 años, vive en la ciudad de Ica, la cual se caracteriza por su clima cálido en cualquier época del año, su agricultura y sobre todo por la amabilidad de sus pobladores, es una mujer muy entusiasta y emprendedora, es madre de un hijo el cual es mayor de edad, uno de sus pasatiempos favoritos es salir a pasear y visitar a su familia, como buena peruana le gusta mucho la comida típica de nuestro país, por ello uno de sus platos favoritos es el riquísimo Arroz Chaufa.

Gladys es una mujer muy entusiasta y emprendedora, ella trabaja en su negocio de venta de cosméticos, al cual le dedica alrededor de 4 horas diarias, en las cuales hace visitas en los domicilios de sus clientes ofreciendo sus productos, ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque siempre atiende bien a sus clientes y les ofrece mucha facilidad en el pago de los productos, por ello lo clientes siempre compran lo que ella ofrece.

Gladys esta muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que con la ayuda que le han brindado ella podra comprar mas productos para ofrecer, lo que le permitira tener mas variedad y asi aumentaran sus ingresos, con ello ella seguirá luchando para cumplir su gran sueño:” Tener una Bodega”.
texts.en:
Gladys is fifty-two and lives in the city of Ica, known for its year-round warm climate, agriculture, and, above all, the kindness of its residents.  Gladys is a very enthusiastic and enterprising woman and the mother of one grown son. One of her favorite pastimes is going out for a walk to visit her family.  Like any good Peruvian, she really likes her native food, particularly the super delicious arroz chaufa [Peruvian fried rice].

Gladys is quite enthusiastic and a real doer.  She works in her own cosmetics vending business for about four hours every day, calling on clients' homes to sell her products. She believes things are going well with the business because she always serves her clients well and makes the payment process easy so they never stop buying what she has.

Gladys really appreciates Kiva lenders because with their help she'll be able buy more merchandise and offer more variety so she can increase her income and keep on striving for her greatest dream, "to have a grocery store."

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Pilika Group

texts.en:
Micheal is in his early 50s and is married with four children. One of his children goes to school and the rest are adults. Since 1980 Micheal has been a mechanic and has had a daladala (minivans that operate as busses) transportation business. He works from 8 in the morning until 7 at night daily to make a very good monthly profit. Micheal is a member of the loan group Pilika, which has 17 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans. 

Micheal is requesting a loan to service his vehicle. This will be his second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. Micheal successfully repaid his previous loan that he used to pay daladala insurance. His dream is to one day be able to buy another new daladala.

loans.use: to service his vehicles

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy flour, cooking oil and beans

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida lives in Yambio.  She operates a food stall and has been in business for five years.  She is 35 years old, married, and has six children, three of them are still in school.

Aida heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her second loan from BRAC.  She has requested a loan of SDG 1000 in order to purchase onions and beans.  She will use her extra income from this loan to pay school fees.

loans.use: buy onions and beans

loans.name: Chawki

texts.en:
Chawki is a 52-year-old married man and father of five children.  He spends his whole life struggling for their happiness and making their living. 

Chawki has been working in construction for 22 years.  He specializes in painting and is an expert in his field.

Chawki has been Kiva partner Al Majmoua's borrower for four cycles.  All his previous loans reflected positively on his social and financial situations.  He is a borrower in good standing.

Chawki is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua in order to do necessary maintenance for his car, which is very important to his business  in transporting  tools and materials from/to projects he is working on.  Chawki hopes to expand his business more in the future and to be capable of buying his own home instead of living in a rented one.

loans.use: perform maintenance on his car

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Flordeliza is married. For the past ten years she has sold dried fish in the Philippines, working hard to support her family. She has requested a 13,000 PHP loan from NWTF to buy more fish to dry and sell.

In the future, Flordeliza would like to expand her business and make some home improvements.

loans.use: to buy more fish to dry and sell.

loans.name: Ife Ibodun 1 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe IFE IBODUN 1 est composé de trois personnes qui vivent dans le même quartier. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Estelle, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. Estelle est âgée de 38 ans et est mariée à un certain  François. Le couple a quatre enfants, dont certains sont scolarisés. Tous les enfants sont à leur charge. Estelle vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants et assure ensemble avec son mari les diverses charges de la famille. Estelle a arrêté l’école au niveau primaire. Il y a près de huit ans que Estelle mène comme activité, la vente de bijoux et des produits cosmétiques au Benin. Estelle s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d'affaire, Estelle sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe IFE IBODUN 1, un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
IFE IBODUN 1 is a group made up of three women who live in the same neighborhood.  Estelle is the representative of the group, and she is the one raising her hand in the photo.  She is 38 years old and married to a man named François.  The couple has four children, all in their care.  Some of the children are in school.  Estelle lives with her husband and children and takes care of the various family expenses with her husband.

Estelle left school at the elementary level.  For about eight years, she has been selling jewelry and cosmetic products in Benin.  She buys her goods at a market in Benin.

In order to meet the needs of her customers, and to increase her turnover, she is requesting a first loan from ALIDé, along with the other members of the IFE IBODUN 1 group.

loans.use: to buy cosmetic products and jewelry.

loans.name: Yelena

texts.ru:
Елена – замужем, у нее двое детей. Она со своей семьей живет в городе Мелитополе. Елена занимается торговлей пряжей на одном из рынков своего родного города. Она всегда предлагает широкий ассортимент товара по приемлемым ценам, имеет свою клиентскую базу. Этим бизнесом занимается уже с 1998 года. На данный момент размер ее оборотного капитала составляет 25 000 гривен. Прибыль – 8 000 гривен. 

Елена планирует вложить полученные от КИВА средства в приобретение партии товара в ассортименте для последующей его реализации на рынке. За счет получения дополнительной прибыли Елена планирует сделать ремонт в квартире, улучшать свой быт и развивать дальше бизнес. 
Пометка: история на русском языке
texts.en:
Yelena is married and has two children. She and her family live in the city of Melitopol. Yelena sells yarn at one of the markets in her home city. She always offers a wide range of products at affordable prices, and has a steady customer base. She has been operating this business since 1998. Currently, she has a working capital of 25,000 hryvnias, and makes 8,000 hryvnias in profits.

Yelena is planning to use her Kiva loan to purchase a new lot of assorted yarn for subsequent resale at the market. She is planning to use her additional profits to carry out repairs in her home, improve her living conditions, and to continue growing her business.

loans.use: to purchase a batch of yarn for resale

loans.name: Villa Anta Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “VILLA ANTA” iniciará su quinto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal Los Andes, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Nora. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de maltin, tejido de alfombras, venta de comida, confección de pelotas, venta de salteñas, venta de helado, venta de frutilla.

La señora Nora,  indica que hace ciclos que trabaja en Pro Mujer y que integro la institución por invitación de una promotora. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de alfombras que viene trabajando hace años, aprendiendo el mismo de sus padres.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de alfombras) que adquirirá de El Alto y posteriormente lo venderá en su puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella vive en unión libre y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta área de salud.

En la fotografía no esta presente la señora Francisca por razones culturales.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Villa Anta" will begin its fifth loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the "Los Andes" regional office. It is composed of eight members and is directed by a board of directors headed by Señora Nora. The businesses which the members of the communal bank run are varied; among them we have selling Maltin (a nonalcoholic malt-based beverage), weaving rugs, selling food, making balls, selling salteñas (baked empanadas), selling ice cream, and selling strawberries.

Señora Nora indicates that she has worked with Pro Mujer for a number of cycles and that she joined the institution through the invitation of a loan officer. Now she has a business where she sells rugs, in which she has been working for years, having learned the business from her parents.  

The loan that she will take out now will be used to increase her capital (buy rugs), which she will acquire from El Alto and later sell at her sales stall. This form of work allows her to generate resources to support her family, since she is in a common-law marriage and has two children.

When she is asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the health center.

Señora Francisca was not present in the photograph for cultural reasons.

loans.use: to buy rugs

loans.name: Pascuala

texts.es:
Pascuala es madre de familia de 40 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo y su hijo en una zona rural donde se dedican a la agricultura y ganadería exclusivamente, la casa en la que viven es propia y esta ubicada en el caserío de nombre “Sinchi Roca” el cual pertenece al distrito de Tambogrande y el mismo a la provincia de Piura. Por ser un pequeño caserío en vía de desarrollo por ahora solo cuenta con servicio de energía eléctrica.

Cliente cuenta con un negocio de venta de comida y chicha de jora para lo que ha acondicionado un lugar en su propio domicilio para la atención de sus clientes atendiendo solo 4 días a la semana (viernes, sábados, domingos, lunes) los mismos que son de mas afluencia de su publico a quien atiende con mucho respeto y cuidado. 
Al negocio se dedica junto a su esposa quien apoya desde las primeras horas del día hasta terminar con la venta estimada.

Se ha propuesto en hacer mas grande su negocio para poder obtener mayores utilidades para lo que esta dispuesto en invertir en la compra de mobiliario (mesas, sillas) para poder recibir mas clientes ya que considera que lo que tiene por ahora limita a sus ventas diarias. Para lograr ese objetivo esta solicitando un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa por un monto de 2000 Nuevos Soles.
Pues se han ganado el cariño de sus clientes y de sus vecinos debido a que son una familia muy unida y trabajadora.
texts.en:
Pascuala is a mother, 40, who lives with her husband and son in a rural area where everyone works in farming and cattle ranching. They own their home in a village called Sinchi Roca which is in the district of Tambogrande in the province of Piura. Because it's a small village on the road to development, right now the only utility they have is electricity.

She has a business selling food and chicha de jora [a corn drink] which she has set up in her own house where she serves her customers 4 days a week (Friday-Monday). She attends her customers with an abundance of respect and care.

She works with the support of her husband from the early hours of the day until she finishes her estimated sales.

She has proposed increasing the size of her business so that she can make more money. For that reason she wants to invest in the purchase of furniture (tables and chairs) so that she can receive more customers because right now she feels like that is limiting her daily sales. In order to achieve this objective she is asking for a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 2000 nuevos soles.

She has won the affection of her customers and neighbors due to the fact that they are a very united and hardworking family.

loans.use: to buy furniture (chairs and tables).

loans.name: Airtime Group

texts.en: Clever is a 34 year old married man from Masvingo, Zimbabwe. He has two children. One child is still going to school. He is into the business of selling cellphone airtime credit cards. Clever has been in the business for two years. He has requested a loan of $150.00 to buy more stock. With the income from the loan he will be able to provide for his family. The challenge he faces in the business is that the product margin is very small therefore he has to sell large volumes of airtime for better returns. His vision for the next 5 years is to open a wholesale business selling airtime cards such that he will be in a position to supply airtime for both network providers in the country.

loans.use: to buy airtime card to sell in his cellphone business.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 27 years old and married with three children, two of whom are still in school. She lives in Yambio and for the past two years has run a food stall. Grace heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer and this will be her forth BRAC loan.

Grace is requesting a 2,000 SDG loan from BRAC to purchase onions and beans. She will use the extra income from her loan to pay school fees.

loans.use: to purchase onions and beans

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is 47 years old, married, and has 10 children.  She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines.  She has been farming rice for 10 years.  

Wilma is borrowing PHP 11000 through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.  She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: buy fertilzers and farm supplies

loans.name: Raad

texts.en:
Raad is from Iraq. He is 46 years old, married and has four children.

Since 1996 Raad has owned a garage, repairing and fixing cars. He has sufficient experience in this field and a deep understanding of local customers and their needs. He has a good reputation and is well known in his neighborhood.

Raad is requesting a 3000 USD loan from CHF in order to renovate his garage, make more shelves and buy a neon sign for his shop. He is aiming to make more in profits so as to provide a better life for his family.

loans.use: to renovate his garage, make more shelves and buy a neon sign for his shop.

loans.name: Norka Zadith

texts.es:
Norka es una joven de 24 años, la cual es muy luchadora y entusiasta, ella vive en la ciudad de Ica, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido en cualquier época del año, así como también por su agricultura y sus por la generosidad de sus pobladores, la comida peruana es muy deliciosa por ello uno de los platos que le gusta mucho es el riquísimo “lomo Saltado y la Chanfainita”.

Con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación ella logro iniciar su negocio de confección de joyas, venta de mochilas entre otros, ella le dedica a su trabajo alrededor de 12 horas diarias y puede atender hasta 15 clientes en el día, ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy amables en la atención así como también siempre tiene modelos novedosos y con precios cómodos.

Norka está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a su apoyo ella podrá mercadería en especial ropa de temporada de verano para ofrecerla también en su negocio, lo que le permitirá tener mayores ingresos y variedad en los productos, así ella tendrá mas ingresos y podrá seguir luchando para cumplir su gran sueño:” Tener un local propio en el centro de la ciudad”.
texts.en:
Norka is a young woman of twenty-four.  She is enthusiastic and a real fighter.  She lives in Ica, a city known for its year-round warm climate, agriculture, and the generosity of its residents.  Peruvian food is really delicious; Norka especially likes super tasty marinated steak stir-fry and oxtail stew.

With a lot of hard work and dedication, Norka managed to start her own business selling jewelry, backpacks, and other items.  She works around twelve hours per day and is able to serve roughly fifteen clients daily.  She believes she's doing well in business because she provides very pleasant service and always has new styles at good prices.  

Norka is very appreciative of Kiva lenders; thanks to their support she'll be able to buy more merchandise, particularly summer clothing to add to her business.  This will allow her to make more income and provide greater variety.  That way she can keep fighting to achieve her greatest dream, which is to, "have her own shop in the center of the city."

loans.use: to buy merchandise (summer clothing).

loans.name: Rene

texts.en:
Rene worked 18 years for heavy equipment businesses such as Bricks Equipment, where he received many requests for street construction signs. In November 2010, with a wide customer base and experience, Rene decided to quit his job and work for himself. He started his Harlingen, Texas, home business, VF Sales & Equipment. About eight months later, his business grew out of his house into a stand-alone store. 

The business sells and leases construction signs and related equipment to local construction businesses including traffic control companies.

“There’s no one really that got into it,” he said about the business. “That’s why we got into it.” Rene services the Brownsville, Alice and McAllen area in South Texas, where, he says, competition is growing. 

His business employs two full-time workers and one who is part-time. He hopes to hire seven more employees within the next year. “Maybe that’s pushing it; let’s say five,” he said. “Seven would be ultimate. If we open other locations, it’ll be well over seven.”

Rene will use the ACCION Texas loan for working capital and inventory. Right now, he has 15 to 20 pieces such as diesel-powered light towers for overnight construction workers, barrels and various signs. “There are well over 100 different types (of equipment) that we’d like to have,” Rene said.

“It’s critical,” he said about his ACCION Texas loan. “I think we’ll stay in business because the inventory I’m buying with that loan will help us bring in more revenue and make profit. Without the right inventory, it’s hard to stay in business.”

Without a loan, Rene said it is difficult to say exactly what would have happened to his business, the profits of which help him support his wife and two daughters. “I would’ve done anything I can,” he said. 

“It would have definitely hurt us; we might not have been able to continue without it. Originally, the loan was to cover start-up costs. That’s what helped us,” Rene said. “Once we get over that hump and get that revenue in, I think we’ll be able to stand alone then pay it back quicker than the term.”

Rene said he saw a void in the marketplace for traffic control and construction equipment and VF Sales & Equipment is filling that void.

loans.use: To pay for additional pieces of construction equipment to sell or lease.

loans.name: Moyo Murefu Group

texts.en:
This is 45-year-old Getrude from Harare, the capital of Zimbabwe and a member of the Moyo Murefu Group. She is married with three children, one of whom is attending school.

For the past two years Getrude has raised chickens to sell. She says the main challenge she faces is the short supply of day-old chicks.

Getrude and her group members have requested a loan of $1600 from MFK. With her $400 portion of this loan she will buy chicken feed and laying hens. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to enhance her family’s welfare.

In the future Getrude plans to be a supplier of both eggs and chicken meat to various supermarkets in the country.

loans.use: to buy chicken feed and laying hens.

loans.name: Igor

texts.ru:
Игорь – из Гладковки. Он – фермер. На 20 сотках земли выращивает в теплицах 4 000 кустов огурцов и 2 тонны раннего картофеля за сезон. Сельским хозяйством занимается уже 4 года. В хозяйство вложил немалые деньги – около 70 000 гривен. Чистая прибыль составляет немногим больше 3 000 гривен. 

Игорю необходимы дополнительные заемные средства в размере 7 000 гривен для того, чтобы купить полиэтиленовую пленку на сумму в 4 500 гривен и перетянуть ее в теплицах для нового сезона, а также хорошие семена для выращивания рассады на оставшиеся 2 500 гривен. Бизнес позволяет Игорю генерировать средства, чтобы содержать семью и это крайне немаловажно в регионе, где зачастую совсем мало возможностей для трудоустройства. 
Пометка: история на русском языке
texts.en:
Igor is a farmer in Gladkovka. On one-fifth of a hectare of land, each season he grows 4,000 cucumber plants in greenhouses, as well as 2 tons of early potatoes. Igor has been farming for four years and has invested a significant sum in his farm - around 70,000 hryvnias. His net income amounts to slightly  over 3,000 hryvnias. 

Igor needs to borrow additional funds totalling 7,000 hryvnias to purchase plastic film for 4,500 hryvnias and re-cover his greenhouses for the new season. The remaining 2,500 hryvnias will be spent on quality seeds from which he will grow sprouts. His business allows Igor to generate enough income to support his family, and this is very important in a region where employment opportunities are often sparse.

loans.use: to buy new plastic film for his greenhouses, and seeds for growing sprouts

loans.name: Toribia

texts.es: La Sra. Toribia tiene 52 años no esta casada pero convive con su pareja con el cual tienen hijos que son 10, 8 y 14 que se encuentra en edad escolar, la Sra. Toribia se dedica a la  agricultura, siembra maíz y papa, su parcela  que se encuentran ubicada en Monte Grande, este es el primer préstamo que tiene con la institución, La Sra. Toribia usara este préstamo para para los gastos que implica la  siembra de papa y la cosecha de maíz La Sra. Toribia enfrenta retos en su negocio que son salir de la pobreza . Va a utilizar los beneficios par mejorar su calidad de vida y la  de su familia, la Sra. Toribia se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución con el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Mrs. Toribia is 52 years old, she isn’t married but lives with her partner, they have 10, 8, 14 year old children who are in school. Mrs. Toribia works in agriculture, she grows corn and potatoes, and her land is located in Monte Grande. This is her first loan with the institution and it will be used to for the expenses incurred in growing potatoes and her corn crops. Mrs. Toribia has some challenges in her business but her goal is to get out of poverty, she will use the benefits from the investment to improve her quality of life as well as that of her family. Mrs. Toribia is happy and grateful with the institution for the support given to her.

loans.use: improve her potato and corn harvest.

loans.name: Aniuwe

texts.en:
Aniuwe lives in Yambio. She sells clothes and has been in business for three year. She is 25 years old, married, and has one child one who is still in school. 

Aniuwe heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her forth loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 2500 in order to purchase clothes. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fee.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for sale.

loans.name: Sari Indah Group

texts.en:
The Sari Indah received their loan with the same amount as the last time and the members also received the same amount.

Ni Ayu will use this loan to buy five superior piglets. She decided to choose the superior quality piglets because they bring in a high price when  she sells them later and it's easier to find a big buyer. She hope the business can run smoothly and give her enough profit to support her family.

loans.use: To purchase five superior piglets

loans.name: Sreymom

texts.en: Sreymom, 26, is single and resides with her sister in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She and her sister are teachers in private school. They earn about USD 7 per day. Due to the difficulty with her family’s transportation, Sreymom is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase a motorbike for commuting. In the future, she would like to rebuild her present house to make it much stronger and to provide a better living conditions for the family.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy fruits, such as oranges and tangerines, for resale.

loans.name: Carla Fiorella

texts.es:
Carla es una joven de 22 años que convive junto a su pareja y ambos tienen un pequeño de 2 años de edad al cual adora mucho y por el cual ella daría la vida con verlos feliz y que no pase penurias; ella vive en la ciudad de Ica, 	ciudad que se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido en cualquier época del año, así como también por su agricultura y sus por la generosidad de sus pobladores, la comida peruana es muy deliciosa por ello uno de los platos que le gusta mucho a Carla son los riquísimos Tallarines Rojos; en su tiempo libre a Carla le gusta escuchar música , porque es una manera de relajarse, debido a los pocos recursos económicos de sus padres solo pudo estudiar educación primaria pero le hubiera gustado estudiar secretariado.

Con mucho esfuerzo y ahorro logro iniciar su negocio de venta de ropa al cual le dedica alrededor de 5 horas diarias, ella ofrece sus productos visitando las casa de sus clientes, ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque ofrece productos de cálida y que están de moda.

Carla agradece a los prestatarios Kiva ya que con la ayuda brindada ella podrá comprar mas mercadería en especial para la temporada escolar, lo que le permitirá poder ofrecer mayor variedad de productos y tener mas ingresos, para así seguir luchando y poder cumplir su gran sueño:” Tener una Tienda propia y darle una buena calidad de vida a su hijo”.
texts.en:
Carla, 22, is a young woman who lives with her parents and has a 2-year-old son who she adores and for whom she would give her life to see him happy and without difficulties. She lives in the city of Ica, known for its warm climate year round and also for agriculture, and the generosity of its people. Peruvian food is delicious and one of Carla's favorite dishes is Tallarines Rojos. In her free time Carla likes to listen to music, because it's a way for her to relax. Given her parents' limited financial resources, she was only able to complete elementary school, but she would have liked to go to high school.

With hard work and savings she was able to start a business selling clothing, where she works about 5 hours a day. She goes to her customers homes to make sales. She thinks its going well because she offers quality, fashionable products.

Carla is thankful to the Kiva lenders because with their support she will be able to buy more merchandise in time for the school season. This will allow her to offer a greater variety of products and make more income so that she can keep fighting to reach her dream: having her own store and giving her son a good quality of life.

loans.use: to buy merchandise (for the school season).

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en: Fatuma is taking another Kiva loan of KES 40,000 to improve her carpentry business. With the loan, she wants to purchase timber, nails and clamps. She dreams of becoming a wholesale supplier of vegetables in the future. She says, "Thanks to Yehu and Kiva lenders for giving me an opportunity to improve my business."

loans.use: To purchase timber, nails and clamps.

loans.name: Matilde

texts.es:
La Sra. Matilde tiene 64 años de edad, está soltera, tiene 2 hijos ya todos casados que viven en la Argentina.
Tiene un comedor bien equipado, es su local propio, viven en la ciudad de Coronel Oviedo donde tienen su local. Se inicio como rentista, y después abrió su comedor, que hasta hoy le va muy bien, con clientela ya bien formada por su antigüedad en el rubro. Ya que conoce muy bien el mercado al que se dedica.
Solicita el crédito para las compras de carne, condimento, panificados, y demás insumos  con los cuales prepara los alimentos que vende. Agradece a la fundación y a kiva por la ayuda recibida.
texts.en:
Mrs. Matilde is 64 years old, single and has 2 children who are married and live in Argentina.

She has a well equipped dining space in her own stall. She lives in the city of Coronel Oviedo where she has her business. She began her work by renting the dining space and later on opened her own. At present, she has been doing very well and has an established customer base due to the time she has spent working in her field since she knows her work very well.

Mrs. Matilde needs the loan to buy meat, spices, bread, and other materials that will be used to make the food that she sells. She is grateful to the foundation and Kiva for the help received.

loans.use: buy meat, spices, bread, and other materials.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace lives in Yambio where she sells from a food stall. She has been in business for two years. She is 27 year old, married, and has one child whose is not in school. 

Grace heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 in order to purchase rice and beans. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase beans and rice for sale.

loans.name: Shingirirai Group

texts.en:
Beauty, 33, is married with three children aged eleven, eight and one, two of whom are in school. She and two others comprise the Shingirirai Group of borrowers.

For the past five years Beauty has bought and sold cattle. She buys them in the countryside and sells them to butcheries in town. The high cost of ferrying the cattle to town is her biggest challenge.

The Shingirirai Group has requested a 1200 USD loan, 400 USD of which Beauty will use to buy more cattle to sell. With the income generated from this loan she will be able to save and be in a better position to provide for her family.

In the next five years Beauty would like to own her own butchery.

loans.use: to buy more cattle to sell.

loans.name: Santa Librada Group

texts.es:
El Comité de Mujeres “Santa Librada” empezó a trabajar con la Fundación Paraguaya mediante la promoción hecha a una de las miembros, quien fue miembro de un comité de la zona que ya no volvió a renovar, la misma ha decidido buscar para sus socias y  luego de una constante comunicación y visita de la  asesora se logró formar un grupo integrado por 12 mujeres de la misma zona. Las señoras son muy unidas, responsables y solidarias, tienen muchas ganas de trabajar y salir adelante, tanto con el grupo y familiarmente. Mencionaron que se encuentran trabajando muy a gusto en equipo, con mucho esfuerzo y esmero, en forma conjunta dentro del programa Comité de Mujeres.
Victoriana es una de las miembros del grupo, ella se dedica a la venta de queso y leche, y comenta que tiene muy buena clientela ya que siempre tiene muy buenos productos. Gracias a su trabajo ha podido salir adelante y de esa forma ayudar a su familia con lo que lo de su negocio. Su meta es poder seguir creciendo y de esa forma poder seguir ayudando a su familia.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de leche y queso para tener en stock y de esa forma seguir ayudando a su familia. Agradecen todas ellas por la oportunidad que les da fundación paraguaya y kiva.
texts.en:
The women's committee "Santa Librada" started working with the Fundación Paraguaya through the promotion of one of its members who had been part of another committee in the area that didn't get renewed. She decided to look for partners and after a lot of communication and a visit from the adviser she was able to form a group of 12 women from her zone. The women are very united and responsible and are very willing to work hard to get ahead, both within the group and with regards to their families. They mentioned that they are very happy working in a team, with a lot of effort and care, under the program Comite de Mujeres.

Victoriana is one of the members of the group. She sells cheese and milk and says she has a very good clientele because she always has good products. Thanks to her work she has made progress and been able to help her family. Her goal is to be able to keep growing her business and therefore keep helping her family.

She asked for a loan to buy milk and cheese to have in stock. She thanks everyone for the opportunity that Kiva and the Fundacion Paraguaya have given her.

loans.use: to buy milk and cheese.

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en:
Loreta is widow and a potter in the Philippines. She has been in this business for seven years now and earns additional income by selling food. She works hard to support her family.

Loreta has requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more materials to make her pottery. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more materials to make her pottery.

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
Magdalena is 55 years old, married and has five children. She is a hardworking entrepreneur.

For the past ten years Magdalena has run a restaurant in the Philippines. She has requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy the ingredients needed in her restaurant.

Magdalena would like to save enough money to expand her restaurant sometime in the future.

loans.use: to buy the ingredients needed in her restaurant.

loans.name: Angel

texts.es:
El Sr. Angel es de la ciudad de Coronel Oviedo, tiene 52 años de edad, estuvo casada por más de 25 años, del matrimonio nació una hija; Carolina de 28 años. por cosas de la vida se separó y con mucho sacrificio se repuso,  acompañado de su hija montaron un copetín en su domicilio.
El Sr. Angel comenzó su pequeño negocio hace cinco años, monto un copetín con su única hija quienes quedaron choqueados por la experiencia que les toco vivir, comenta que que en principio fue muy difícil, pero con el apoyo de sus vecinos y familiares lograron salir adelante, ahora cuentan con clientela formada y sus productos son bien caseros y del agrado de todos ellos. El mayor sueño de don Angel es aumentar su negocio ofreciendo  un lindo comedor.
El solicita el crédito para la compra de Carne, huevo, discos, aceite, gaseosas, y demás insumos que utilizará en su copetín. Agradece a la fundación y a kiva por la oportunidad que recibe.
texts.en:
Sr. Angel lives in the city of Coronel Oviedo. He is 52 and was married for more than 25 years. A daughter was born to the marriage, Carolina, who is 28.  Due to things that happen in life, he became separated but, with a lot of sacrifice, he did recover. Accompanied by his daughter, he started a small restaurant in his house.

Angel started his small business five years ago. As noted, he did so with his only daughter. Both of them were shattered by the experience they had been through. He notes that at first, it was very difficult, however with the support of neighbors and relatives they were able to move forward. Now they have an established clientele and their home-made products are well liked  by all. Angel’s biggest dream is to increase his business by offering a nice dining room. 

He is requesting a loan to buy meat, eggs, turnover dough, cooking oil, soft drinks and other supplies that will be used in his restaurant.  He is grateful to the Fundación and Kiva for the opportunity he is receiving.

loans.use: to buy meat, eggs, turnover dough, cooking oil, soft drinks and other supplies.

loans.name: Edwin

texts.es: El Sr. Edwin tiene 34 años no esta casado pero tiene su pareja tiene tres hijos que son de 3, 6, 8 años de edad, se dedica a la  agricultura, siembra de papa y de maíz, su parcela se encuentran en Paso el Chivo, este es el primer préstamo que saco con  la institución, El sr. Edwin   va a usar este préstamo  para los gastos que implica la siembra de papa y cosecha de maíz,   y  utilizara los beneficios mejorar su siembra, tener mas ingresos y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida. El Sr. Edwin es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz y agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado ya que esta es la única actividad con la que el Sr. Edwin mantiene a su familia.
texts.en: Mr. Edwin is 34 years old, he is not married but he and his partner have three children of 3, 6 and 8 years of age. He works in agriculture by growing potatoes and corn, his field is located in Paso el Chivo. This is his first loan with the institution and will use the money to pay for the expenses garnered by his potato and corn harvest. Mr. Edwin will improve his crops and have more income that will lead to a better quality of life. Mr. Edwin is a very hardworking person and is very happy and grateful with the institution for the support since this is the only source of income for Mr. Edwin to take care of his family.

loans.use: improve his potato and corn crops.

loans.name: Agbékè Séraphine

texts.fr: Agée de 41 ans, mariée et mère de trois enfants, Séraphine a sa baraque dans le plus grand marché de la ville  où elle vend ses produits dont les sachets plastiques et les produits de soins corporels. Elle a sollicité l'aide de Finadev pour fournir plus d'articles à ses clients fidèles et potentiels.
texts.en: At the age of 41, Séraphine is a married mother of three. She has a stall at the large market in the city where she sells her products, such as plastic bags and personal care products. Séraphine has requested aid from Finadev to furnish more items for her loyal and prospective customers.

loans.use: to buy a sack of plastic bags, a box of eau de cologne, a box of hair straightener, a box of toothpaste, and a box of body powder.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a greater number of coconuts to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Santosa

texts.es:
Santosa tiene 32 años, vive en la ciudad de pisco, ciudad que se caracteriza por hermosas playas, por su clima cálido y por uno de los atractivos turísticos más hermosos de nuestro país que son las islas ballestas y el candelabro, Santosa ama la comida peruana y uno de los platillos que mas le gusta es el riquísimo “Ají de gallina”, es madre y tiene 2 hijos cuyas edades comprende 4 y 14 años, a los cuales quiere muchisimo y son su razon de vivir, por razones económicas ella solo pudo estudiar hasta el quinto grado de educación secundaria, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar gastronomía porque le gusta mucho Cocinar.

Gracias a la buena sazón que tiene para la preparación de platillos ella inicio su negocio de venta de uno de los platos bandera del Perú que es el riquísimo “Ceviche”, desde hace 11 meses Santosa se levanta muy temprano para ir en busca de los insumos para la preparación de este platillo, trabaja alrededor de 8 horas diarias y puede atender hasta 30 clientes en el día, ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque tiene una buena sazón y además porque trata a los clientes de manera amable.

Santosa agradece mucho a los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a su ayuda ella podrán una congeladora y un mostrador para la venta de sus platillos, lo que le permitirá conservar de manera optima los insumos que utiliza en la preparación y tener mas orden al exhibir sus productos, con ello seguirá trabajando y luchando para cumplir su mas grande sueño:” Tener su local Propio”.
texts.en:
Santosa is 32 years old. She lives in the city of Pisco, a city that is characterized by beautiful beaches, a warm climate, and one of the most beautiful tourist attractions of our country, the Ballestas Islands and the Candelabro. Santos loves Peruvian food, and one of the dishes that she likes most is the very delicious "aji de gallina" (chili pepper chicken, a Peruvian chicken stew). She is a mother and has two children whose ages are 4 and 14 and whom she loves very much and who are her reason for living. For economic reasons, she could only go to school up to the fifth grade of secondary education, but she would have liked to study gastronomy, because she very much likes to cook.

Thanks to her good cooking skill in preparing dishes, she began her business selling one of the Peruvian flagship dishes, the very delicious ceviche, 11 months ago. Santosa gets up very early to go in search of the ingredients to prepare this dish. She works about eight hours a day and can serve about 30 customers a day. She believes that she is doing well in her business because she is a good cook and furthermore, she treats her customers in a kindly manner.

Santosa is very grateful to the Kiva lenders since thanks to their help she will be able to buy a freezer and a display case for the sale of her dishes, which will permit her to store the ingredients that she uses in preparation in an optimal manner and to have more order in showing her products. With it she will continue working and striving to accomplish her greatest dream, "to have her own business location."

loans.use: to buy a freezer and a display case

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
El  Sr. Francisco es de la ciudad de Santaní, tiene 61 años de edad, está casado con la Sra. Isabel de 42 años de edad. Actualmente tienen 2 Hijos, todos mayores de edad, que trabajan de forma independiente.
Francisco tiene una despensa en su domicilio particular,  y nos cuenta que gracias a sus buenos precios y a la buena calidad de sus productos, ya cuenta con clientela formada, lo que le ha ayudado a poder seguir sosteniendo a su familia.
El solicita el crédito para la compra de verduras, lácteos, panificados, azúcar, arroz y demás insumos necesarios para poder abastecerse y de esa forma poder ofrecer mayor variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Sr. Francisco is from the city of Santani. He is 61 and married to Sra. Iabel, 42. They have two sons, both now adults who have their own jobs.

Francisco has a store in his home and tells us that, thanks to his good prices and the good quality of his products, he has an established clientele. This has helped him to be able to support his family.

He is requesting a loan to purchase vegetables, dairy products, bakery goods, sugar, rice and other needed supplies to stock his store. In this way, he will be able to offer greater variety to his customers.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables, dairy products, bakery goods, sugar, rice and other supplies.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is a 39-year-old widow from Kisumu who has four children aged from fourteen to twenty years.

For the past ten years Amina has sold cereals, making 15,000 KES a month. She is receiving her first loan from KADET LTD, which she will use to buy stocks of maize, rice, beans and green grams, or mung beans. She will use her profits to educate her children.

Amina’s dream is to own a big cereals shop in Kisumu.

loans.use: To buy stocks of cereals to sell.

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en:
Thomas is a 40-year-old man from Migori County, West of Kenya. He is married to Christine and they have five children aged between five and 18 years.

Thomas operates a brick selling business which he has done for the last five years making a monthly income of KES. 10,000. He is now taking his fourth loan from KADET LTD which he will use to buy bricks for sale. 

He will use the anticipated profits to pay the loan from KADET. His dream is to live well and educate his children.

loans.use: To buy bricks for sale.

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en:
Benjamin is a 37 year old man from Kisumu City and is married to Everlyne and they have six children whose ages are between two and 12 years old.

Benjamin operates a retail stall selling various items like watches and wallets. He has been in this business for the last 13 years and makes a monthly income of KES. 10,000. He is taking his first loan from KADET LTD, which he will use to buy a stock of sunglasses, watches and wallets. 

His profits will be used to educate his children. His dream is to have a big business in Kisumu City.

loans.use: To buy stock of sunglasses, watches and wallets.

loans.name: Ditha

texts.en:
Ditha lives in Yambio. She sells from a food stall, and has been in business for five years. She is 30 years old, married, and has four children, two of them are still in school. 

Ditha heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer, This is her second loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 1000 in order to purchase rice  and beans. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay school fees.

loans.use: to purchase beans and rice for sale.

loans.name: Bebilyn

texts.en: And now, Bebilyn is borrowing Php 12,000 to fund her vegetable farming business. The vegetables garden that she previously funded through KIVA partner and NWTF continues to provide her and her family with income that is improving their living condition.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm tools.

loans.name: Mariama

texts.fr: Mariama a 40 ans, mariée et mère de quatre enfants. Elle commercialise des produits de la brasserie. Dans le souci de mieux fournir ses produits à ses clients en vue de les satisfaire, elle est venue auprès de Finadev demandée une aide financière pour atteindre ses objectifs.
texts.en: Mariama is 40 years old and a married mother of four children. She markets brewery products. Concerned about furnishing more of her products to her customers, so as to satisfy them, Mariama has come to Finadev asking for financial aid to achieve her goals.

loans.use: to buy 16 cases of brewery products

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose's group is comprised of 3 hard working women. Rose is 20 years old and lives in the town of Kyengera in the Kampala West region of Uganda. She is married and has 2 children with 1 of them currently in school. Rose has been working hard to manage her salon which does hairdressing. 

To help expand her business, Rose has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy hair braids for resale and will help Rose to generate greater profits and pay school fees for herself. Rose hopes that in the future she will be able to expand her business. 

Rose is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Rose's future prospects by helping her to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy hair braids for resale

loans.name: Afuraha

texts.en:
Afuraha is a 28 year old business man who lives in Juba. He is married and has two children between the ages of 5 and 1. One of the children goes to school. 

Afuraha runs a mixed store business, and he has been in the business for one year.  He has no employees. Afuraha heard about Finance Sudan from the loan officer’s word of mouth promotion done in the market. He is taking a loan of 1000 to purchase more items like, sweets, try cells,  wool and many others. In addition to this business, Afuraha has no other source of income. 

In 5 years time, Afuraha hopes to have a big business at least in his own good building. 

His major challenges include the high standard of living in Juba and feeding his only child.

Afuraha says that, "He has only thanks given to finance south Sudan for the support."

loans.use: to purchase more items like sweets, try cells, wool and many others to sell.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to customers.

Rowena has been in this business for 10 years. She earns more income from food vending.

Rowena has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so that she could afford to send her children to college and expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to customers.

loans.name: Celia

texts.es:
Celia es madre soltera de 2 hijos los cuales son menores de edad, ella tiene 45 años de edad y tiene casa propia, el caserío en el que vive es pequeño de aproximadamente unas 40 familias dedicadas a la agricultura y ganadería. El caserío en el que vive se llama “Las Pampas“ el cual pertenece al distrito de Olmos a dos horas de la Ciudad de Chiclayo. Pues gracias al esfuerzo de sus habitantes ya su caserío ha logrado construir su propio colegio y su capilla, faltándoles por ahora obtener el servicio de agua potable pues solo cuentan con el servicio de energía eléctrica.

Celia se dedica a venta de prendas de vestir, pues a esta actividad ya se viene dedicando un aproximado de  5 años, cuanta con sus clientes fijos quienes la visitan a su propio domicilio para realizar sus pedidos, adicionalmente y complementariamente a sus mismo clientes les ofrece productos de belleza para lo que sale de caserío en caserío a ofrecer sus diferentes productos.

Celia solicita un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa por un monto de 2000 Nuevos Soles los cuales serán invertidos en la compra de mas prendas de vestir, las cuales serán enviadas por un familiar desde la Ciudad de Lima, pues considera de que aun tiene mercado por captar.

Ella se ha dispuesto en mejorar su negocio con el fin de generarse mayores ingresos para darles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Celia is the single mother of two children who are minors. She is 45 and has her own house. The settlement where she lives is small; approximately 40 families who make their living farming and raising livestock. The settlement where she lives is called Las Pampas, which is part of the Olmos district, two hours from the city of Chiclayo. 

Thanks to the efforts of its inhabitants, her settlement has already managed to build its own school and chapel. For now, they are lacking potable water service, since they only have electricity service.

Celia sells articles of clothing and has been doing this work for approximately five years. She has her regular customers who visit her at her home to place orders. In addition, and to supplement this, she sells beauty products to the same customers, for which she goes from settlement to settlement to offer her various products.

Celia is applying for to Edpyme Alternativa for a loan in the amount of 2,000 nuevos soles, which she will use to buy more articles of clothing. These will be sent by a family member from the city of Lima, as she believes that she still has a market to capture. She has resolved to improve her business, with the aim of generating greater income, in order to give her children a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy clothing to add to her business.

loans.name: Dinora Berenice

texts.es:
La señora Dinora se dedica a la venta de accesorios para dama que son bolsas, aretes, collares,  zapatos, esta solicitando un crédito para invertir en comprar de mercancía ya que por la temporada navideña se quedo sin productos para vender y desea comprar mercancía de verano, pero no cuenta con el dinero necesario para llevar a cabo esta inversión en su negocio. Ya que todo lo que vendió se lo pagan en abonos. 
Dinora es madre soltera y tiene dos hijos de mediana edad que actualmente están estudiando y desea mejorar la calidad de vida y que tengan un mejor futuro.
Planea pagar el crédito con las ganancias que obtiene de su negocio. Ya que tiene otro ingreso que es de su empleo en las oficinas de vialidad publica de la ciudad.
texts.en:
Señora Dinora sells women's accessories such as purses, earrings, necklaces, and shoes. She is applying for a loan to invest in buying merchandise, since she was left without products to sell because of the Christmas season, and she wants to buy summer merchandise, but she does not have the necessary money to make this investment in her business, since everything that she sold is being paid for in installments.

Dinora is a single mother with two children who are now in school, and she wants to improve their quality of life and for them to have a better future.

She plans to pay off the loan with the earnings that she obtains from her business, since she has another income, which is from her job in the offices of the public highway department of the city.
