The “FLOR DE ROSA” communal bank will begin its first cycle in Pro Mujer, as a part of the Santiago II center. It is made up of six members and is led by a board of directors headed by Rufina. The members' businesses in the communal bank are varied. Among them are: selling underwear, selling salchipapas, selling washed sand, selling skirts and selling weaving.  

Rufina indicates that she has been working with Pro Mujer for a year and joined the institution when she was invited by one of her friends. At present, she has a knitting business selling sweaters and blankets. She has been doing this for awhile, having learned at a business where she used to work.  

The loan she will take out now is to increase her capital. She will buy wool that she will acquire at fairs and later sell in her commercial space. This work allows her to generate resources to support her family. She is married and has three children.  

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the health aspects.  

In the photograph Elvira is not shown for cultural reasons.

loans.use: to buy wool.

loans.name: Lucia Libertad

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal San Pedro se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio del mismo nombre en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Lucia, tiene 47 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen un hijo  de  17 años  de edad, el cual este año ingresa a la universidad.  Su esposo realiza mantenimiento a los barcos.

Ella es un ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto poder ayudar a su esposo en los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de productos de Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, trabaja tres días a la semana en sus entregas y cobros ya que  deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. También los días sabados y domingos instala un pequeño local en su casa en el cual vende deliciosos ceviches y encebollados de pescado lo cual le deja muy buenos ingresos en estos días. Tiene más de 10  años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos, pescado y otros víveres para preparar los alimentos. Lleva 10 años en el Banco Comunal, es la presidenta del mismo y está muy orgullosa de su grupo por que es muy cumplido.
 
Su sueño es tener un gran restaurante.
texts.en:
Every two weeks the 'San Pedro' community bank meet in the neighborhood of the same name, in the city of Manta.  This city is well known for its beautiful beaches which are very popular year round.  It is a city with many tourist attractions and a beauty which is second to none.

Here we meet Lucia.  Lucia is 47 years old, married, and has a 17-year-old son who is entering university this year.  Her husband carries out maintenance work on boats.

Lucia is a housewife who, in order to make her own income and help her husband with the household expenses, sells Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and ladies' accessories).  She makes her sales door to door.  She works three days a week delivering her products and collecting payment as she leaves her products on credit and collects payment every week.  On Saturdays and Sundays, she sets up a small area in her home where she sells delicious 'ceviche' (a marinated fish dish) and 'encebollados de pescado' (a type of fish stew) which makes her very good income.  She has been in this business for more than ten years and is doing very well.

Lucia is requesting this loan to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics, fish and other supplies she needs for making her food.  She has been a member of her community bank for ten years and is the bank's president.  She is very proud of her group because it is an excellent group.

Lucia's dream is to own a large restaurant.

loans.use: to buy perfume, creams, cosmetics, fish and other supplies for making food

loans.name: Wilma Colombia

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal San Pedro se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio del mismo nombre en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Wilma, tiene 42 años de edad, está casada hace varios años pero no ha podido tener  hijos. Su esposo es chofer.
 
Ella es una ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto poder ayudar a su esposo en los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de ropa y de productos Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Ella sale a recorrer  tres días a la semana aunque también vende en su casa a la hora que sus clientes deseen una prenda, ella deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Tiene más de 12 años que se dedica a esta actividad, ella también cose ropa pues aprendió corte y confección hace varios años atrás.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y ropa en general. Lleva 17 años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por los beneficios que le brinda el banco.
 
Sus sueños son seguir adelante en su negocio y en su vida.
texts.en:
Every two weeks the 'San Pedro' community bank meet in the neighborhood of the same name, in the city of Manta.  This city is well known for its beautiful beaches which are very popular year round.  It is a city which has a lot of tourist attractions and a beauty which is second to none.

Here we meet Wilma.  Wilma is 42 years old.  She has been married for several years but has not been able to have children.  Her husband is a driver.

Wilma is a housewife who, in order to make her own income and help her husband with the household expenses, sells clothing and Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume and ladies' accessories).  She goes out to sell her products three days a week, though she also sells from her home whenever her customers want to buy something.  She leaves her products with her customers on credit and collects payment every week.  She has been in this business for more than twelve years and she also sews clothing as she learned dressmaking some years ago.

Wilma will use this loan to buy perfume, creams, cosmetics and clothing.  She has been a member of her community bank for 17 years and she likes it because of the benefits provided by the bank.

Wilma's dreams are to make progress in her business and in her life.

loans.use: to buy perfume, creams, cosmetics and clothing

loans.name: Candida Rosa

texts.es: Cándida Rosa esta emprendedora se dedica a su negocio que es una librería que la tiene ubicada en su casa de habitación  donde atiende a sus clientes que le solicitan los productos. Ella ha venido trabajando con Fundación León 2000, en el crédito otorgado anteriormente realizo las compras de productos para la librería. Actualmente está solicitando financiamiento para la compra de productos como fólder, lápiz de grafitos, hojas en blanco, borradores, lapicero, regla, engrapadoras, pega, cartulina entre otros productos.
texts.en: Cándida Rosa is an entrepreneur that sells supplies out of her home to customers that come looking for items to buy. She has worked with Fundación León 2000 before, having received a prior loan to stock her store. Now she seeks credit to buy materials for her business such as folders, pencils, paper, erasers, pens, rulers, staplers, glue and other items.

loans.use: to buy folders, pencils, paper, erasers, pens, rulers, staplers, glue and other items

loans.name: Viviana Guadalupe

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal San Pedro se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio del mismo nombre en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Viviana, tiene 31 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 10, 3 y de 1 año  de edad, el mayor estudia en escuela.  Su esposo se dedica a la pesca.

Ella es un ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto ayudar a su esposo en los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de ropa, carteras, zapatos y  productos de Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Ella sale a recorrer  todos días unas tres horas diarias, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Sus productos los compra en una distribuidora en Portoviejo cada vez que necesita mercadería. Tiene más de 7 años que se dedica a esta actividad, ella siempre vende productos o prendas que estén de moda ya que es lo mas salida tiene.

Este crédito es para comprar ropa, zapatillas, carteras, perfumes, cremas y cosméticos. Lleva 7 años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que  le brinda el banco y sus amigas.
 
Su sueño es tener un local propio.
texts.en:
The San Pedro communal bank meets every two weeks in the neighborhood of the same name in the city of Manta, a city known for its beautiful beaches which are visited frequently all year round and for being a city with unequaled beauty and many tourist attractions.

Here we meet Viviana. She is 31 years old, married, and has three children aged 10, 3 and 1 years old. The oldest is in school. Her husband is a fisherman. 

She is a housewife who to get her own resources and to help her husband with household expenses sells clothes, purses, shoes and Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume and women's accessories). She goes out every day for three hours, sells her products on credit and collects every week. She buys her products at a distributor in Portoviejo every time she needs merchandise. She has been doing this activity for more than 7 years and always sell products or items of clothing that are in style since those are the most popular. 

This loan is to buy clothes, slippers, purses, perfumes, creams and cosmetics. She has been in the communal bank for 7 years and she likes it for the help that the bank gives her and her friends. 
 
Her dream is to have her own locale.

loans.use: to buy clothes, slippers, purses, creams, perfume and cosmetics.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
This is Juanita, 43, resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She is married to Francis, a driver.   Juanita and her husband operate the business while managing their own household.  At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Juanita operates a variety store.  In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood.  It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php12,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Juanita hopes to be able to expand soon and dreams of being able to give her family a good future through all her hard work. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Salim

texts.en: Salim is requesting another Kiva loan of KES 50,000 to boost on his charcoal selling business. With the loan, he wants to purchase sacks of charcoal and establish a retail shop business, purchase shop items, like wheat flour, maize and sugar.  He dreams of owning a motor vehicle for the transportation business in future.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Khanh

texts.en:
Khanh, 53 years old, is married and has three children, two sons and one daughter. She and her husband support their family through the income they earn from making iron latches. They began this business ten years ago. They live in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Khanh intends to take a loan to buy a large quantity of iron. The additional materials will enable her to increase her production and sales of latches. She hopes her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy iron to produce latches.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose lives in Yei, she is 33 year old, married, and has four children, three of them are still in school.   Rose sells food at a food stall.  She has been in business for four years. 

Rose heard about BRAC South Sudan from credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC.  She has requested a loan of 700SDG in order to purchase beans and rice.   She will use the extra income from this loan to pay the school fees for her children.

loans.use: to purchase beans and rice for her food stall.

loans.name: Nguyet

texts.en:
Nguyet is 45 years old and married with three children. She lives with her family in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City.  Her husband earns income as a driver for hire.  Nguyet runs a cafe to earn a living. 

She started her business ten years ago.  With this loan, she intends to offer a variety of beverages for her customers at the cafe, and gradually expand her business.  She hopes her business runs smoothly and help improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a variety of beverages for her cafe.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
This is Teresita, 55, resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She is married to Fernando, a technician.   Teresita and her husband, manage their own household while operating the business.  At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Teresita operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She also operate a copier machine and offer school supplies for additional income. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php27,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Teresita hopes to be able to expand soon and dreams of being able to give her family a good future through all her hard work. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items and more inventory for her store.

loans.name: Van

texts.en:
Van, 40, is married and has two children.  She lives with his family in Ho Chi Minh City.  Her husband is a driver for hire.

Van has been running a beauty shop and a general store in front of her house for four years.  She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a greater variety and quantity of basic products to stock her general store and better satisfy her customers.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions and sending her children to school.

loans.use: To increase the variety and quantity of inventory for her general store.

loans.name: Luong

texts.en:
Luong, 59, is married and has four children, one son and three daughters.  She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City.  Luong and her husband earn an income running a generel store in front of their house. 

She started this business thirty years ago.  She sells sugar, toys for kids, soft drinks, yogurt and other household items to people in her community. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a greater variety of products, in particular foods and beverages, to stock her store and better satisfy her customers.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a variety of food and beverages, to stock her store.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is a 33-year-old married man with five children, all of whom are enrolled in school. His wife's name is Nzadze and she works as a farmer, while Patrick has been operating a retail shop business for six years, his primary customers passersby and neighbours. Patrick's other source of income is charcoal-selling. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water, and his highest monthly expense is food. His greatest business challenge is the high cost of transportation.

Patrick joined Yehu to access capital and is now requesting a loan of Kes 50,000 to purchase bundles of wheat flour, sugar, cooking fat oil and rice. He aspires to establish a wholesale business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, sugar, cooking fat oil and rice.

loans.name: Sulaiman

texts.en:
This is 50-year-old Sulaiman.  He is married and has 1 child, age 3 yrs. He has 1 additional dependent who lives with him.  In 1999, Sulaiman established his textiles business. He began his business because at the age of 19 years he went to one of the diamond mining towns known as Kono. However, due to the rebel war in Sierra Leone, they were attacked by rebels, and he fled to Makeni where he started doing petty business with the small amount of money he had by then. 

After some years when the business developed, he decided to come to Freetown, the capital city of Sierra Leone, to continue his business until now. Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, he earns about Le 1,500,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. Suliaman requires a loan in order to buy one bundled bail of cotton @ Le 4,500,000. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 1,000,000. 

In the future, Sulaiman plans to build a house so that he can live comfortably with his family, and he hopes to see his children educated to university level. He thanks you for your help.

loans.use: to buy one bundled bail of cotton.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
This is Emma, 54, resident of Quezon City, Philippines. She is married to Manuel, her business partner, and is the mother to her children. She, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Emma operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 1,000 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 38,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Emma hopes to be able to expand soon. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Nhanh

texts.en:
Nhanh is fifty-one years old and is married. She has four children and lives with them and her husband in Ho Chi Minh City.

She has run a general store at her hourse for thirteen years. She sells milk, beverages, stationery, and confectionery. She intends to use her loan to buy many kinds of products to sell from her store, such as eggs, sugar, and sanitation items.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her family's living conditions and save money for her children's education.

loans.use: To buy many kinds of products such as eggs, sugar, and sanitation items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Maria Santos

texts.es: María de cincuenta años de edad vive con su compañero de vida y su hijo. Ella posee una venta de relojes y lentes de forma ambulante que hace en diferentes zonas cercanas a la que vive, además elabora y vende jarabes medicinales naturales, es muy conocida en la zona y se ha hecho de mucha clientela, pues todo lo que comercia es de muy buena calidad y a precios realmente accesibles además el servicio es inigualable; María es una mujer emprendedora con muchas ganas de salir adelante siempre aprovecha todas las oportunidades que se le presentan, piensa que al cosechar una idea se cosecha un deseo; quiere ver crecer su negocio y está dispuesta a trabajar duro para lograrlo, es por eso que se decidió a solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar relojes, lentes, materia prima para los jarabes entre otros. María tiene la confianza que de esta forma podrá darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida
texts.en: 50-year-old María lives with her life partner and child.  She has a business selling watches and lenses as an itinerant vendor.  She sells in nearby areas.  She also makes and sells natural medicinal syrups.  She is very well known in her area and has a lot of customers because everything she sells is very good quality and she sells at really affordable prices.  In addition, her customer service is second to none.  María is an entrepreneurial woman who has a great desire to do well in life.  She always makes the most of every opportunity that comes along.  She believes that in harvesting an idea you are harvesting a desire.  María would like to see her business grow and is ready to work hard to achieve this.  She is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL to buy watches, lenses, and supplies for making her syrups.  She is certain that this will enable her to provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy watches, lenses and supplies for making syrups

loans.name: Alba Esperanza

texts.es: Alba Esperanza su negocio al que se dedica es a dar los servicios de transporte ya tiene años de tener este negocio en lo cual brindado a sus hijos lo mejor. Esta emprendedora ya ha trabajado con Fundación León 2000 lo cual ha demostrado ser una persona responsable y con buenos valores y mantiene un record crediticio intachable. Actualmente Alba Esperanza está solicitando financiamiento para realizarle algunas mejoras a su taxi que posee como las compras de llantas, gasolina, y realizar las mejoras a su unidad.
texts.en: Alba Esperanza's business is providing a transport service.  She has been in this business for years and it has enabled her to provide for her children.  This entrepreneur has already worked with Fundación León 2000.  She has shown herself to be a responsible person and has an impeccable repayment history.  Alba Esperanza is currently requesting a loan to make some improvements to her taxi.  She will buy tires and gas, and make some improvements.

loans.use: to buy tires and gas, and to make some improvements to her vehicle

loans.name: Ivan

texts.en: Ivan is a forty-year-old hardworking man with seven children living in Kasese, Uganda. He has been a farmer for the last ten years, and his major hardships have been high transportation costs and inadequate capital to purchase enough feeds. However, he has a goal of hiring employees to help expand his business and increasing the number of pigs. Ivan needs a loan to buy timber and cement to use in the construction of his modern pigsty.

loans.use: to buy timber and cement for constructing a modern pigsty.

loans.name: Ngan

texts.en:
Ngan is 58 years old and is widowed. She has been running a cafe and a general store in front of her door for 22 years. She started this business to cover her expenses and raise her two children. They live in Ho Chi Minh City.

Ngan is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a greater quantity and variety of food and soft drinks to stock her store. She hopes that through the loan she will be able to expand her business activities and have money to reinvest in her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more food and many kinds of soft drinks for selling.

loans.name: Thuan

texts.en:
Thuan is a 48-year-old married woman. She lives with two daughters and her husband in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband earns money as a security guard. For two years, she has run a beauty shop selling cosmetics and beauty products to people in her community.

Thuan would like a loan to purchase better quality products at competitive prices from wholesalers. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her customers and attract additional customers. 

She also hopes that through her loan she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties facing her family.

loans.use: to purchase better quality cosmetic products at competitive prices from wholesalers.

loans.name: Bintihamisi

texts.en:
Bintihamisi is a 27-year-old single woman. She operates a tailoring business and sells her goods in a shop. She's worked in this business for 2 years. Her primary customers are passersby and neighbors. Her other source of income includes a retail shop business. 

Her highest monthly expense is food for the family. She rents a house that has both electricity and piped water. She will use the Kes 30,000 loan to purchase cloth materials and embroidery for her business. Bintihamisi aspires to establish a boutique in the future. She joined Yehu to access capital.

loans.use: to purchase cloth materials and embroidery for her business.

loans.name: Sajabi

texts.en:
Sajabi, aged twenty-four, is a farmer from Kyenjojo, Uganda. He has been working in agriculture for the last three years. He is married with four children whom he wants to educate in the future. He dreams of buying  more land to grow crops on a large scale.

Sajabi intends to use the loan to clear land in preparation for the next planting season.

loans.use: to clear land in preparation for the next planting season.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a twenty-two-year-old married man living in a semi-permanent house in Kyenjojo, Uganda. His desire is to have a family business. He started as a farmer and later started selling produce, something he has done for three years now. 

John intends to invest the loan in buying maize to sell.

loans.use: to buy maize to sell.

loans.name: Basilisa

texts.en:
This is Basilisa, fifty-three, a resident of Quezon City, Philippines. She is married to Jesus, her business partner, and is the mother of four children. She, together with her husband and children, manage their own household while operating the business. 

Basilisa operates a motorcycle oil distribution business. There is more need, now than before, for services like these as customers’ demand increases. She makes profit by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her products are motor oil and products of the like. Her regular customers are her neighbours and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 1,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a PHP 20,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy additional stocks of supplies and products needed for her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Basilisa dreams of being able to give her family a good future through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

 
* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional stocks of supplies and products needed in her motorcycle oil business.

loans.name: Ana Jahaira

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal San Pedro se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio del mismo nombre en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.

En este lugar vive la señora Ana, tiene 28 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos de 10, 7 y 4 años de edad los mismos que estudian en escuela. El marido es ayudante de cocina en un restaurante.

Ella tiene una tienda de comestibles en su casa en la cual vende todo tipo de productos como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, legumbres, carnes y además también vende ciertos licores, trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00  hasta las 22h00 y a veces hasta más tarde, su esposo le ayuda en su trabajo cuando está desocupado. Tiene 4 años con su negocio el cual empezó con muy poco y con el paso de los meses y con la ayuda de los créditos la ha ido aumentando y mejorando.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar carnes, legumbres, arroz, detergentes, embutidos y otros productos de primera necesidad. Está en el Banco Comunal hace 5 ciclos y le gusta porque ha hecho más amigas en el grupo. 

Sus metas son seguir adelante en su negocio y que su tienda crezca cada día más.
texts.en:
The San Pedro community bank meet every two weeks in the neighborhood of the same name, in the city of Manta.  This city is well known for its beautiful beaches which are very popular year round.  It is a city with many tourist attractions and a beauty which is second to none.

This is where Ana lives.  Ana is 28 years old and lives with her common-law husband.  The couple have three children who are 10, 7 and 4 years old.  They are all attending school.  Ana's husband is a chef's assistant in a restaurant.

Ana has a grocery store in her home where she sells all kinds of products such as rice, sugar, oil, detergents, vegetables and meat.  She also sells some liquor.  She works every day, from 6.00am to 10.00pm and sometimes until even later.  Her husband helps her with her work when he has any free time.  Ana has been in her business for four years.  She started out with very little but as the months have passed, and with the help of loans, she has managed to increase and improve the business.

Ana will use this loan to further stock her store.  She will buy meat, vegetables, rice, detergents, cold cuts and other basic household products.  She has been a member of her community bank for five loan cycles and she likes it because she has made friends in her group.

Ana's goals are to continue working in her business and to further expand her store.

loans.use: to buy meat, vegetables, rice, detergents, cold cuts and other basic household products

loans.name: Emelita

texts.en:
This is Emelita, 33, resident of Quezon City, Philippines. She is married to Erwin, her business partner, and is the mother to her three children. She, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Emelita operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 1,000 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 33,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Emelita hopes to be able to expand soon. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Dimitri

texts.en:
Dimitri is 58 years old. He lives in the village of Atskuri in East Georgia with his wife, Nelly. Dimitri works as worker-constructor in his own and nearby villages. Nelly works as nurse in the village. Along with their main jobs, the family is involved in agriculture. 

They have small dairy farm with 2 milk cows. Nelly produces traditional Georgian cheese and sells on average 40 kg of this product to local dairy product retailers. Her cheese has a high quality and she never has a problem with sales. Dimitri grows maize on a family-owned 1 hectare plot of the land. 40% of the harvested corn is used for feeding the cows and the rest is sold on the local market. The total average monthly income of the family is 700 Laris. 

Dimitri requested credit for purchasing a milk cow. Nelly will be able to increase production and sales of cheese by 50%. The income of the family will increase by 150 Laris. Family members will be able to spend more on satisfying their daily needs and improving the family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow.

loans.name: James B.'s Group

texts.en:
Pictured above are primary school teachers in Magburaka, a town in northern Sierra Leone. This group of teachers has come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, to apply for a loan. With the help of this loan, these teachers are going to buy goods or invest in businesses or pay school fees for their children. At the end of each month, they repay the loan, using their monthly salaries. Their school’s bursar is directly responsible for doing the deductions and making the repayments on their behalf.

James is the leader of this group of teachers. He is a 46-year-old man. Born in Masimgbi village near Magburaka town in northern Sierra Leone, James is married to a teacher and the couple has 3 children – two in primary school and 1 in college. James has been a teacher for 26 years now. He has requested this loan in order to buy house building materials like iron corrugated zincs for the construction of a family dwelling house.

loans.use: to buy house building materials like iron corrugated zincs for the construction of a family dwelling house.

loans.name: Dimitri

texts.en:
Dimitri is 55 years old. He lives in the village of Pshaveli in East Georgia with his wife, Marta, who is a housewife. Dimitri owns a tractor and he works on road construction with his tractor. He earns 800 GEL a month, which is the only income of the family. 

Recently, Dimitri’s tractor  stopped working, and so did Dimitri. He is requesting credit to purchase parts for his tractor so he can fix it. After he repairs the tractor, he will be able to continue working and the family will have income again.

loans.use: to purchase tractor parts.

loans.name: Elena Mariana

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal San Pedro se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio del mismo nombre en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.

En este lugar vive la señora Elena, tiene 42 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos de 20, 19 y 14 años de edad, todos aun viven en su casa y estudian en universidad y colegio. El marido es comerciante.
 
Ella se desempeña como maestra de una escuela de la ciudad, pero también se dedica a vender ropa de todo tipo los fines de semana y también les vende a sus compañeras y madres de familia que llegan hasta el establecimiento educativo en el cual labora.   Su  esposo se dedica a la   venta de pescado, el cual tres o cuatro veces por semana se desplazan hasta las playas de la ciudad a donde llegan las embarcaciones pesqueras para comprar el pescado y llevarlo a entregara a las diferentes restaurantes de la ciudad. Los dos llevan más de 12 años que se dedican al comercio.

Este crédito es para el invertir en los dos negocios, van a comprar pescado y ropa de todo tipo. Lleva 13 años en el  Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le ha brindado la institución.
 
Sus sueños son comprar un carro o tener un local en su casa.
texts.en:
The members of the San Pedro community bank meet every two weeks in the neighborhood of the same name, in the city of Manta.  This city is well known for its beautiful beaches which are very popular year round.  It is a city with many tourist attractions and a beauty which is second to none.

This is where Elena lives.  Elena is 42 years old and lives with her common-law husband.  The couple have three children who are 20, 19 and 14 years old.  They all still live at home and are attending university and high school.  Elena's husband is a salesman.

Elena works as a teacher at an elementary school in the city and sells clothing on weekends.  She also sells to her work colleagues and to mothers who come to the school where she works.  Her husband sells fish.  Three or four times a week they go to the beaches in the city where the fishing boats arrive.  They buy fish and then take it and deliver it to different restaurants in the city.  The couple have been in business for more than 12 years.

Elena will use this loan to invest in her two businesses.  She will buy fish and clothing.  She has been a member of her community bank for 13 years and she likes it because of the help that she has received from the institution.

Elena's dreams are to buy a car and to have a place in her home from which she can make her sales.

loans.use: to buy fish and clothing

loans.name: Antonio Dolores

texts.es: Antonio Dolores de sesenta y un años de edad vive con su compañera de vida y sus hijos. El posee una venta de artículos varios en una zona muy concurrida de personas, últimamente ha aumentado la demanda de sus productos, ya que todos son de excelente calidad y los vende a precios accesibles, además el servicio es muy bueno, Antonio se porta muy amable con toda la clientela que lo visita, es un hombre entregado a su trabajo, siempre se mantiene muy enérgico y con ganas de estar adelante de su competencia, piensa que los mas grandes secretos para alcanzar el triunfo son la constancia y la dedicación, es así como se decidió a solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar juguetes, carteras, esmaltes, papel de regalo, cintas para zapatos entre otros. Antonio Dolores tiene la confianza de que así podrá darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida
texts.en: 71-year-old Antonio Dolores lives with his life partner and children.  He has a store where he sells a variety of merchandise.  The store is located in a very busy area.  Demand for his products has recently increased as the goods he sells are all excellent quality and he offers them at affordable prices.  In addition, his customer service is very good.  Antonio is very kind to his customers and committed to his work.  He always remains very energetic and keen to stay ahead of the competition.  He believes that the big secrets to success are perseverance and commitment.  He decided to request a loan from INTEGRAL to buy toys, wallets, nail polish, gift wrap, laces, etc.  Antonio Dolores is certain that this will enable him to provide his family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy toys, wallets, nail polish, gift wrap, shoelaces, etc.

loans.name: Nena

texts.en:
This is Nena, 34, resident of Quezon City, Philippines. She is married to Angel, her business partner, and is a mother with three children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.
  
Nena operates a food stall. In the Philippines, the whole working community and most of the families only eat home-cooked meals during evenings, when all of the family members are at home to take part in the meal. This is not only a common family tradition but a matter of convenience and frugal living. It is considered a waste of money and time to spend money on cooking gas and food for one or two persons, when buying cooked rice and other foods cost less than raw food. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php 700 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 38,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings, and also frozen food products. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Nena dreams of being able to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw ingredients and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a 51-year-old married man with 10 children. He lives in a permanent house in the district of Kyenjojo in Uganda. He is a farmer who has been in agriculture for the last 20 years.

Joseph inherited land from his parents on which he grows crops. His dream is to venture into mechanized agriculture. Joseph is requesting a loan to pay workers who are tilling his land for the next planting season.

loans.use: to pay workers who are tilling his land for the next planting season.

loans.name: Kasenene

texts.en: Kasenene, age 30, is a married man who lives in a semi-permanent house in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He is a farmer who farms Irish potatoes and maize produce. He dreams of educating his children, and building and expanding his food store. Kasenene is requesting a loan to buy maize to sell.

loans.use: to buy maize to sell.

loans.name: Djidjoho

texts.fr: Djidjoho est âgée de 42 ans et vit au Bénin. Djidjoho est marié à une marchande du nom de Célestine. Djidjoho a arrêté l’école au niveau primaire et a appris la couture. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés. En dehors de leurs enfants, le couple a un autre enfant à leur charge. Djidjoho et sa femme assurent ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Pour faire face à ses différentes charges, Djidjoho exerce le métier de couture depuis cinq ans environs. Cette activité lui permet ainsi de satisfaire aux besoins de ses enfants et de subvenir à ses besoins. De façon secondaire, Djidjoho fait de la transformation de noix de palme en huile de palme. Djidjoho désire mieux équiper son atelier de couture par l’acquisition d’une nouvelle machine à coudre et des fournitures de couture ; ce qui lui permettra de répondre efficacement aux exigences de sa clientèle. Pour cette raison, Djidjoho sollicite pour la deuxième fois un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le premier crédit a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
Djidjoho, age 42, lives in Benin. He's married to a merchant named Célestine. Djidjoho dropped out of elementary school, and learned sewing. The couple has four children, who all attend school. In addition, the couple has another child in its care.

Djidjoho and his wife make sure together that the various household expenses are covered. To this effect, Djidjoho has been working as a tailor for about five years. This business enables him to provide for himself and for his children's needs.

As a secondary business, Djidjoho also transforms palm nuts into palm oil. He wants to improve his workshop's equipment by purchasing a new sewing machine and sewing supplies. This will enable him to meet customer demand in an efficient way.

For this reason, he's seeking a second loan from Kiva's partner, ALIDé. The first loan was repaid without problems.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine, sewing supplies, and palm nuts

loans.name: Aurelia Brenda

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal San Pedro se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio del mismo nombre en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Aurelia, tiene 40 años de edad, hace varios años su esposo falleció pero de esa relación tuvo cinco  hijos de 23, 21, 18, 14  y 6 años de edad, tres de ellos aun viven en su casa y estudian en universidad, colegio y  escuela.
 
Ella es un ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto sacar a sus hijos adelante  se dedica a la venta de ropa y de productos de Lebel, Avon (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Ella sale la mayoría de los días a recorrer la ciudad con sus productos ya que algo tiene que vender en el transcurso del día, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días, la ropa la compra en Guayaquil ciudad a la que viaja cada vez que ella necesita mercadería. Tiene más de 7 años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar ropa, perfumes, cremas y cosméticos. Esta desde hace 11 años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los pagos son fáciles de hacer.
 
Su sueño es tener un carro para realizar sus recorridos.
texts.en:
The San Pedro communal bank meets every two weeks in San Pedro in Manta city.  The city is known for its beautiful beaches that are very popular throughout the whole year, and also for being a city with unmatched beauty and a lot of tourist attractions.

This is where we meet Aurelia, age 40.  Her husband died several years ago.  She has five children, ages 23, 21, 18, 14, and 6.  Three of them still live in her house and go to the university, high school, and elementary school.

She is a homemaker.  In order to get her own means of support to get her children ahead she sells clothes and Lebel and Avon products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume, and women’s accessories).  Most days she leaves to make her rounds in the city with her products because something has to be sold during the course of the day.  She leaves her products on credit, and she collects once a week.  

She buys the clothes in the city of Guayaquil, which is where she goes each time she needs merchandise.  She has been doing this business activity for over seven years, and it is going very well for her.

The loan is to buy clothes, perfumes, creams, and cosmetics.  She has been in her communal bank for 11 years.  She likes it because the payments are easy to make.

Her dream is to have a car to make her rounds.

loans.use: to buy clothes, perfumes, creams, and cosmetics.

loans.name: Marcel Evènassè Jean

texts.fr: Marcel Evènassè Jean est âgée de 32 ans et vit au Bénin. Marcel Evènassè Jean est marié à une coiffeuse du nom de Hélène. Marcel Evènassè Jean n’a pas fréquenté l’école, mais a appris la couture. Le couple a deux enfants, dont un est scolarisé. En dehors de leurs enfants, le couple a un autre enfant à leur charge. Marcel Evènassè Jean et sa femme assurent ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Pour faire face à ses différentes charges, Marcel Evènassè Jean exerce le métier de couture depuis treize ans environs. Cette activité lui permet ainsi de satisfaire aux besoins de ses enfants et de subvenir à ses besoins. Marcel Evènassè Jean désire mieux équiper son atelier de couture par l’acquisition d’une machine à broder ; ce qui lui permettra de répondre efficacement aux exigences de sa clientèle. Pour cette raison, Marcel Evènassè Jean sollicite pour la troisième fois un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les deux premiers crédits ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Marcel Evènassè Jean, age 32, lives in Benin. He's married to a hairdresser named Hélène. He never attended school, but did learn sewing. The couple has two children, out of whom one attends school. In addition, they have another child in their care.

Marcel Evènassè Jean and his wife make sure together that the various household expenses are covered. To provide for himself, Marcel Evènassè Jean has been working as a tailor for about thirteen years. This business enables him to provide for himself and for his children's needs.

He would like to improve his sewing workshop's equipment by purchasing an embroidery machine. This will enable him to meet customer demand in an efficient way.

For this reason, Marcel Evènassè Jean is seeking a third loan from Kiva's partner, ALIDé. The first two loans were repaid without problems.

loans.use: to buy an embroidery machine

loans.name: María Delmi

texts.es: María Delmi de cuarenta y tres años de edad vive con su compañero de vida y sus hijos en casa propia. Ella posee una venta de tortillas en el lugar de su residencia, es muy conocida en la localidad ya que vende las tortillas mas ricas, con materia prima de primera calidad y a precios bajos, además el servicio es el mas rápido de la zona; María es una mujer entregada a su labor se levanta desde muy temprano pues sabe que al que madruga Dios le ayuda, quiere mantenerse adelante de la competencia y la perseverancia es su mas grande secreto para hacer crecer su negocio es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar maíz por mayor, leña, cal, gas propano, etc. María Delmi tiene la esperanza que así podrá regalarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: María Delmi is 43 years old and lives with her life partner and children in her own home.  She has a tortilla business at home and is very well known in her town because she sells delicious tortillas, using top-quality ingredients and selling at low prices.  In addition, her service is the fastest in the area.  María is a woman who is committed to her work.  She gets up very early as she knows that God helps those who get up early.  She would like to stay ahead of the competition and perseverance is her biggest secret to growing her business.  She is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL which will allow her to buy corn wholesale, firewood, lime, propane gas, etc.  María Delmi hopes to be able to provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy corn wholesale, firewood, lime and propane gas

loans.name: Jose Mauricio

texts.es: José, humilde, padre de familia, trabaja como guardia de seguridad, su esposa profesora, juntos tienen que velar por el futuro de sus hijos y el bienestar actual. Tiene dentro de sus planes construir su vivienda completamente de concreto cambiando poco a poco la construcción actual y ampliando las arias de cuartos así sus hijos tendrán individualidad y no estar todos juntos como ahora. Nuestro cliente ya lleva adelantado alguna parte de la construcción del cuarto pero se le ha presentado dificultades por la cual no pudo seguir por su cuenta propia, ha encontrado en la financiera el apoyo necesario para cumplir su proyecto.  Invirtiendo el préstamo en la compra de materiales de construcción: cemento, arena, hierro, piedrín, bloques, estribu, perlines, laminas de zinc, tablones, alambre de amarre, piedras canteras, entre otros materiales construyendo así las paredes y entechado la casa. Agradece la oportunidad de construir su cuarto, obteniendo mayor seguridad y comodidad.
texts.en: José, a humble family man, works as a security guard. His wife is a teacher. Together they have to look out for the future of their children and their current well-being. He has plans to build his house completely of concrete, changing the current construction little by little, and enlarging the area of the rooms so that his children can have their own space and not be all together like they are now. Our client has already moved forward with part of the room construction, but it has presented difficulties for him, so he could not continue on his own account. In financing, he has found the necessary support to complete his project. He will use the loan to purchase construction materials: cement, sand, iron, gravel, blocks, supports, purlins, zinc roofing sheets, planks, rebar tie wire, and quarry stone, among other materials, to build the walls and put a roof on the house. He is thankful for the opportunity to build his room and obtain greater security and comfort.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials

loans.name: Miriam Elizabeth

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal San Pedro se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio del mismo nombre en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.

En este lugar vive la señora Miriam, tiene 25 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene un hijo de 11 años el mismo que estudian en escuela. El marido es pintor de barcos. 

Ella es una ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto ayudar a su esposo en los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de zapatillas y zapatos por catalogo. Su forma de venta es ofrecer con su revista y luego cuando ya tenga varios pedidos envía el pedido el mismo que le llega al otro dia y luego se encarga de entregar, estos productos los deja a crédito y cobra cada 15 días. Lleva dos años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien, así ella se gana algo por su cuenta y se siente útil.

Este crédito es para comprar zapatillas, zapatos y sobretodo sandalias de temporada. Lleva tres años  en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que recibe con los créditos.
 
Su sueño es seguir adelante en su negocio.
texts.en:
The San Pedro communal bank meets every two weeks in San Pedro in Manta city.  The city is known for its beautiful beaches that are very popular throughout the whole year.  It is also known for being a city with unmatched beauty and a lot of tourist attractions.

This is where Miriam, age 25, lives.  She is in a common-law marriage, and she has an eleven year old son who goes to school.  Her husband paints boats.  She is a homemaker.  In order to obtain her own income and help her husband with the household expenses she sells slippers and shoes by catalog.  

The way that she sells is by offering items with her magazine.  Then, when she has several orders, she sends in the order.  When the order comes, she then delivers it.  She leaves these products on credit, and she collects every two weeks.  She has been doing this business activity for two years, and it is going very well for her.

This way she earns something on her own, and she feels useful.

She will use the loan to buy slippers, shoes, and mostly seasonal sandals.  She has been in her communal bank for three years.  She likes it because of the help that she gets with the loans.

Her dream is to get ahead with her business.

loans.use: to buy slippers, shoes, and sandals.

loans.name: Ruth Arely

texts.es: Ruth Arely de cuarenta y tres años de edad vive con su compañero de vida y sus hijos en casa propia. Ella posee una venta de partes de motos en el lugar de su residencia y últimamente se ha hecho de mucha clientela, pues todo lo que comercia es de muy buena calidad y a precios realmente accesibles, además el servicio es excelente; Ruth es una mujer enérgica con ganas de salir adelante y cumplir sus objetivos, piensa que la disciplina y el amor a lo que haces te dan la fuerza para lograr el éxito y es con ese pensamiento que se decidió a solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar partes de motos. Ruth Arely tiene fe que así logrará darle a su familia una vida plena.
texts.en:
Ruth Arely is 43 years old. She lives with her partner and their children in their own house. She owns a motorcycle parts shop in her place of residence. Lately she has made lots of customers as everything she deals with is good quality and at reasonable prices. Also, her service is excellent. 

Ruth is an energetic woman who is eager to get ahead and fulfil her goals. She thinks that discipline and love are what give you the strength to achieve success. With that thought she decided to request a loan from INTEGRAL which will allow her to buy motorcycle spare parts. Ruth Arely has faith that with this she will be able to give her family a full life.

loans.use: to buy motorcycle sapre parts.

loans.name: Rawi

texts.en:
Rawi is a 41-year-old man and is married to Kasmiati, a 36-year-old lady. They have five children, namely: Erwinda, 19, Wildayanti, 18; Aditya, 14, and attending 2nd grade of Junior High School; Bara, 11, attending 6th grade of Elementary School; Fika, 6, attending 1st grade of Elementary School. 

Rawi is an immigrant from Java. He initiated a timber construction business in 2002. Rawi employs seven assistants in running the business. Rawi sells plank wood, rafters, and beams in large quantity and different sizes. In addition, he offers a wood sawmill service as well. 

At the moment Rawi has received an order to provide a certain amount of teak wood but unfortunately he does not have enough stock to meet the order. Therefore, Rawi is requesting a loan from TLM amounting to IDR 4,000,000. He would like to spend the loan on teak wood. He is hoping that he can receive the loan soon.

loans.use: to purchase teak wood for resale

loans.name: Hercules

texts.es:
Hércules tiene 27 años de edad, tiene un hijo y vive junto a su esposa en el caserío rural llamado “CP- 3 “del distrito de Tambogrande, es un caserío pequeño donde la actividad económica principal es la ganadería y agricultura. Por ahora su caserío solo cuenta con el servicio de luz eléctrica.

Actualmente se dedica a la crianza engorde y comercialización de ganado menor y aves de corral en su mayoría, en el caserío donde vive existe bastante competencia en el rubro que se desempeña pero también hay mucha demanda por lo que ya el se ha generado sus clientes, recorre no solo mercados locales si no que también sale a mercados de otros caseríos, y es de su esposa que recibe ayuda para lograr sus objetivos debido a que quieren mejorar su calidad de vida.

Hércules desea comprar alimentos balanceados para su mejor crecimiento y engorde de sus animales para poder ponerlos a mejor precio, por lo que esta solicitando un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa por un monto de 1000 Nuevos Soles para cumplir con sus objetivos.
Es un joven emprendedor y muy responsable, características conocidas por ser un cliente recurrente para nuestra institución.
texts.en:
Hercules is 27 years old. He has one child and lives with his wife in the rural area called "CP-3" of the Tambogrande district. It is a small hamlet where its main economic activities are agriculture and livestock. At the moment his hamlet only has electric services.

At the moment he makes a living raising, fattening and selling mainly small livestock and poultry. In the hamlet where he lives there is quite a lot of competition in this sector that he works in. However, there is also a large demand and he has made customers. He doesn't only travel round the local markets but also goes to markets in other areas. He also receives help from his wife to be able to meet his objectives as they want to improve their quality of life.

Hercules wants to buy balanced feed for his animals to improve their growth and fatten them in order to sell them at a better price. This is why he is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for the amount of 1000 PEN; to fulfil his objectives.

He is an enterprising, very responsible young man, which are qualities that are attested to by his being a regular client with our institution.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed so his animals will be well fed.

loans.name: Roberto Carlos

texts.es: Roberto Carlos de veintisiete años de edad vive con su compañera de vida y sus hijos. El posee una panadería muy conocida en la zona, vende pan en variedad semitas, quesadillas, pastelitos, pan salado entre otros, se ha hecho de mucha clientela últimamente, pues lo que comercia es de muy buena calidad y lo vende a precios accesibles además el servicio es excelente; Roberto es un hombre entusiasta siempre dispuesto a trabajar duro para salir adelante, piensa que el triunfo del verdadero hombre, surge de una base de trabajo bien cimentada, quiere llegar al éxito es por eso que se decidió a solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar harina, azúcar, levadura, leche, dulce etc. Roberto Carlos tiene la esperanza de que de esta forma podrá darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida
texts.en:
Roberto Carlos, age 27, lives with his life partner and their children.  He has a very well-known bakery in the area.  He sells a variety of bread, tarts, quesadillas, and pastries, among others.

He has a lot of customers recently.  What he sells is of a very good quality, and he sells at accessible prices.  Also, the service is excellent.

Roberto is an enthusiastic man who is always ready to work hard in order to get ahead.  He believes that the triumph of a real man arises from a strong foundation of work.  

He wants to be successful.  That is why he decided to request a loan from INTEGRAL.  He will use the loan to buy flour, sugar, yeast, milk, and sweeteners, etc.

Roberto Carlos hopes that this way he will be able to give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like flour, sugar, yeast, milk, and sweeteners.

loans.name: Benon

texts.en: Benon is a fifty-one-year-old married man with seven children. He lives in a semi-permanent house in the district of Kyenjojo, Uganda. He is a farmer who does dairy farming and crop production. He would like to become a prominent farmer by doing agriculture on a large scale. He wants to have a healthy and well educated family. Benon wants a loan to buy maize products for resale.

loans.use: to buy maize for resale.

loans.name: John

texts.en: Having started from produce selling, John is now a proud owner of a bicycle spare parts shop. At the age of 30, he feels his potential is not fully utilized and he wants to deal in motorcycle sales and their spare parts. He wants another loan now to buy bicycle spare parts for resale.

loans.use: to buy bicycle spare parts for resale.

loans.name: Rosa Bonifacia

texts.es: Rosa Bonifacia emprendió su propia herramienta de trabajo con el objetivo de independizarse y inicia el negocio de la venta de  recargas telefónicas, venta de cuajada y alquiler de sillas, frijoles cosidos, el negocio  lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación donde sus clientes la visitan para comprar su producto. Esta emprendedora ya ha trabajo crédito con Fundación León 2000, ha demostrado ser una persona responsable y con buenos valores, actualmente está solicitando financiamiento para comprar productos para el negocio frijoles, recargas movistar y claro, cuajada, leña, hielo entre otros productos.
texts.en:
Rosa Bonifacia learned the tools for her own business with the objective of becoming independent.  She started a business selling phone charging, selling cuajada (a custard-like sweet) , renting chairs and selling cooked beans.  Her business is located in her home where her customers visit her to purchase her products.

This entrepreneur has already worked with a loan from Fundación León 2000, and has demonstrated that she is a responsible person with good values.  She is currently requesting financing to purchase products for her business: beans, Movistar and Claro phone-chargers, cuajada, firewood and ice among other items.

loans.use: to purchase beans, frijoles, Movistar and Claro phone-chargers, cuajada (a custard-like sweet), firewood and ice among other items.

loans.name: Lawrence

texts.en: Lawrence is 35 years old, married, and together the couple has 7 children. Lawrence is a farmer, although he also has a transport business. He has been farming for almost 5 years now. He started by using a hand hoe on a small scale basis and now he uses modern farming equipment. He faces a challenge of price fluctuations and inadequate capital. His family goal is to educate his children and also to buy land for more crop growing.

loans.use: to buy rice and groundnuts for planting.

loans.name: Morris

texts.en: Morris is married with children living in Hioma, Uganda.  He is a farmer and has been farming for 5 years. He faces a challenge of price fluctuations and seasonal variation.  His family goal is to educate his children and build a permanent house for his family.  His business goal is to diversify his business and venture into the transport sector.  Morris intends to buy a motorcycle with the loan facility.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Margerette I.'s Group

texts.en:
Pictured above are primary school teachers in Magburaka, a town in northern Sierra Leone. This group of teachers has come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, to apply for a loan. With the help of this loan, these teachers will buy goods, invest in businesses or pay the school fees for their children. At the end of each month, they will repay the loan, using their monthly salaries. Their school’s bursar is directly responsible for doing the deductions and making the repayments on their behalf.

Margerette is the leader of this group of teachers. The 49-year-old is a native of Magburaka. She is married to a trader and the couple has two children, one of whom attends secondary school. Margerette has been a professional teacher for 29 years now. She has requested this loan in order to buy building materials such as iron and corrugated zinc for the construction of a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy building materials such as iron and corrugated zinc for the construction of a house for her family.

loans.name: Annie

texts.en:
This is Annie, age 59, who is a resident of Quezon City in the Philippines. She is married to Erwin, her business partner. She is also a mother to her four children. She and her husband manage their own household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Annie operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store that retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, cooking oil or an egg. She earns money by buying supplies at wholesale prices and selling them by the piece. Her store is adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community members. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, Annie is requesting a PHP 18,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Annie hopes to be able to expand soon. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group comprises 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to buy grocery items, toiletries and beverages to sell in her variety store.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en: Francis, a 26-year-old married father of three children living in a semi-permanent house in Kyenjojo, Uganda, is a farmer who has been growing Irish potatoes and maize for three years.  Now requesting a loan to buy Irish potatoes for planting, Francis dreams of educating his children and developing and expanding his plantations.

loans.use: to buy Irish potatoes for planting.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is 29 years old. He lives in the village of Chikaani. George married recently and lives now with his wife, Mtvarisa, his parents and an aunt. His aunt has health problems and receives a relevant pension from the government. 

George and his parents are a leading family agricultural farm, which is the only source of income for the family. They have 4 buffalo. George’s mother uses buffalo milk for the production of cheese, which is quite an expensive product on the local market. 

Also the family owns agricultural land, where watermelon, maize, wheat and vine-trees are grown. During busy agricultural seasons, all family members spend their days on the land doing hard work. They sell harvested products on the local market. The total average monthly income of the family is 1,100 Laris.

George requested credit for hiring a tractor for land cultivation and the purchasing of seeds of watermelon and maize. After properly done seasonal work and high quality seeds, he can count on a good harvest, which will be sold at a fair price. It will give the family increased income. George plans to use this increased income for the renovation of their house, which is old and not comfortable.

loans.use: to buy a tractor for land cultivation and to purchase seeds of maize and watermelon.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with three children, and all her children go to school. She takes care of additional family members. She sells charcoal from home on a retail basis. She also gets additional income from poultry farming at home. She works seven days a week. She has been in this business for the last 5 years. 

She has requested a loan of 500,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy bags of charcoal. Her major business challenges are transportation and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations are to expand into a wholesale business and to own 1,000 chickens. She lives in her own house where the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en: Godfrey is 56 years old and married with 6 children, living in Hioma, Uganda. Ever since he was a teenager he has been farming, and this has facilitated him in improving his standard of living. However, he faces a challenge of price fluctuations for his farm products. His family goal is to educate his children, while his business wish is to hire employees to help him on his farm. Godfrey needs the loan facility to buy seedlings for planting.

loans.use: to buy seedlings for planting.

loans.name: Johnson

texts.en: Johnson is 30 years old  and he owns a produce business which he started with a capital of 2,500,000 shillings and his business is now worth six million.  He faces hardships of high fuel and transport costs coupled with inadequate capital to meet the increasing demand.  His business goal is to diversify his business and buy land for crop growing.  Johnson intends to use the loan to buy rice and beans to sell.

loans.use: to buy rice and beans to sell.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en: Daniel is a thirty three year old married man with three children living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He has a produce store located in Kamwenge where he has worked for over four years. He started this business with capital worth two hundred fifty thousand shillings and now has three million shillings as  working capital. Daniel faces a problems of customers not paying on time and theft. His personal goal is to buy a car and the business goal is expanding his business into new markets. Daniel needs this loan to buy maize and beans for sell.

loans.use: to buy maize and beans to sell.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es: Virginia de cincuenta y ocho años de edad vive con su compañero de vida en casa propia. Ella posee una tienda en el lugar de su residencia donde vende artículos de primera necesidad como frijoles, leche, pan, embutidos entre otros, últimamente ha aumentado su clientela pues todos sus productos son de muy buena calidad y los vende a excelentes precios, además el servicio es inigualable, Virginia siempre es muy amable con todos; es una mujer muy activa siempre dispuesta a trabajar y a mantenerse adelante de su competencia, piensa que el crecimiento en una labor, es parte de un proceso que te permite llegar al éxito, quiere tener ese éxito y ver crecer su negocio, es por eso que se decidió a solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar granos básicos, bebidas, productos instantáneos, golosinas, pan, etc. Virginia tiene fe que así podrá llevar a su hogar una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Virginia, age 58, lives with her life partner in her own house.  She has a store in her home, and she sells staples like beans, milk, bread, and sausages, among others.  Recently she has more customers because all of her products are very good quality, and she sells at excellent prices.  Also, the service is unbeatable.

Virginia is always very kind to everyone.  She is a very active woman who is always ready to work and to stay ahead of the competition.  She thinks that growth is work.  It is part of a process that will allow her to be successful.  

She wants to have this success and to see her business grow.  That is why she decided to request a loan from INTEGRAL.  The loan will allow her to buy basic grains, drinks, instant products, sweets, and bread, etc.  Virginia has faith that this way she will be able to bring a better quality of life to her household.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, drinks, instant products, sweets, and bread, etc.

loans.name: María Carolina

texts.es:
En la hermosa ciudad de Calceta se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal San Agustín, ciudad conocida por gente trabajadora y sus mujeres hermosas.
 
En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene 38 años de edad, está casada y frutos de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos de 16, 14, 9 y 7 años de edad, los mismos que estudian en un colegio y en una escuela  de la localidad. Su esposo se dedica a la cría de animales y al comercio. 

Ella para ganar algo por su cuenta y con esto ayudar a sus hijos y a su esposo se dedica al comercio, vende ropa y productos Lebel (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas). Ella casi todos los días recorre la ciudad en una  moto de su propiedad realizando sus  ventas y cobros ya que deja a crédito y cobra todas las semanas, lleva 7 años en este negocio y le va muy bien ya que tienen muchos clientes.

Este crédito es para comprar más ropa, perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y bisutería. Está en el Banco Comunal hace más de siete años y le gusta porque con uno de los créditos ella empezó su negocio.
 
Sus sueños son tener un carro o un local propio.
texts.en:
In the beautiful city of Calceta, the communal bank San Agustín meets every fifteen days. This city is known for its hard working people and its beautiful women.

Maria lives here. She is 38 years old. She is married and from this relationship has four children of 16, 14, 9 and 7 years of age. They study either in high school or in a local school. Her husband makes a living raising animals and trading.

To earn some money herself and to be able to help her children and her husband she sells clothes and Lebel products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and women's accessories). Almost every day she travels round the city on her own motorcycle selling and collecting payments as she sells on credit and collects every week. She has worked in this business for 7 years and now has many customers.

This loan will be used to buy more clothes, perfumes, creams, cosmetics and imitation jewelry. She has been in this communal bank for 7 years and she likes it as with one of their loans she started her business.

Her dream is to have a car or her own premises.

loans.use: to buy clothing, perfumes, creams, cosmetics and imitation jewelry.

loans.name: Hanifa

texts.en:
Hanifa lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has 2 children, both of whom are in school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. Hanifa has a business of a hardware shop. She has been in this business for 7 years, and she works 7 days out of every week. She sells her products in a shop, by means of wholesale. 

She has requested a loan of 700,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bundles of iron sheets, bags of cement and nails. The main business challenges for Hanifa include transportation and defaulters. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a fully stocked hardware shop and to build her own houses. Hanifa lives in a home that she rents where she has access to electricity and to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include feeding the family, rent and school fees.

loans.use: to buy bundles of iron sheets, cement and nails.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is a 45-year-old married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He has six children. He deals in transportation, where he has worked for over fifteen years. He started as a driver who was hired on a daily basis, and after saving enough wages he bought his own vehicle. 

He faces the problems of high fuel and license costs. His main aim is to educate his children. His business goal is to buy land to grow crops so as to spread risks. George wants this loan to buy tires for his vehicle.

loans.use: to buy tires for his vehicle.

loans.name: James
